loans.name: Leata

texts.en: "Leata is a 41 year old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu,yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Leata has requested a loan to buy chain saw, weed sprayer, bushknives and manure chemical. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Leata hopes to support her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chain saw, weed sprayer, bushknives and manure chemical

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional sewing machine

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшеду 37 лет. Они женат и является отцом шестерых детей. У него две дочери и четверо сыновей. Он со своей семьей живет в городе Истаравшан в селе Боботаго. Чамшед занимается торговлей в течение 8 лет. Он продает продукты питания, а также хозяйственные товары. Его магазин находится в селе. Чамшеду в его деятельности помогает жена. С целью увеличения товарооборта он запрашивает кредит для закупа ассортимента товара (продуктов питания и хозтовара) в свой магазин.
texts.en: Jamshed is 37 years old, married and a father of six children.  He has two daughters and four sons.  He and his family live in the city of Istaravshan in the Bobotago village.  Jamshed has been involved in sales for eight years.  He sells food products and also household goods.  His store is located in the village.  Jamshed's wife helps him with the business.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a selection of products (food products and household goods) for his store in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase food products and household goods for his store

loans.name: Carmen Pofiria

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquilla conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Banco Comunal Bankito Rio Bravo.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 57 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ellos. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Carmen tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual tiene de todo para la satisfacción de sus clientes. También se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos para lo cual hace algún tiempo atrás construyó unos pequeños corrales y una granja donde cría sus animalitos. Ella se da tiempo para todo ya que son tareas que no le quitan mucho tiempo y le dejan buenos ingresos, ya que su esposo en el campo no gana mucho. Lleva dos años con su tienda y con la cría de animales desde hace muchos años atrás.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres, alimento y medicinas para los animalitos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con el primer crédito surtió su tienda. 

Su sueño es aumentar su negocio y tenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en:
In Río Bravo de Montecristi, a city noted for its great diversity of typical products like the straw hats that are renowned both inside and outside the country, the members of the “Río Bravo” communal bank meet every 15 days.

Carmen, 57, lives here and she’s in common law relationship from which she has six adult children; one of them still lives with them.  Her husband is a farmer.

Carmen has a small grocery store at home where she stocks everything to satisfy her customers.  She also raises chickens and pigs for which she built some small corrals and a farm some time ago to raise her little animals in.

She sets aside time for everything since they are chores that don’t take up much time and produce good income since her husband does not earn much from the fields.  She’s had the store for two years and the animal husbandry for many more years.


This loan is to buy groceries, feed and medicine for the little animals.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because she stocked her store with her first loan.  Her dream is to enlarge her business and to have it well-stocked.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, food and veterinary medicine.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan,  de 23 años de edad, tiene dos  hijos dependientes, su esposa es la señora  Ana tiene 22 años, ella colabora en la producción agrícola liderando el manejo de la familia. El señor Juan junto a su esposa tuvieron hijos a muy temprana edad, asumiendo así desde muy jóvenes una gran responsabilidad, Juan Pablo y su familia son de escasos recursos económicos,  trabaja desde muy joven en la agricultura junto con su papá incluso tuvo que dejar sus estudios para manejar y administrar las tierras de sus padres  que ahora sus padres por la edad ya no puede trabajarlas como lo hacían antes, ahora Juan Pablo tiene una familia que mantener y alimentar, es por esta razón que está solicitando el presente crédito, para comprar semillas y abonos y de esta forma ampliar su producción agrícola,  como también sus ingresos económicos, este crédito ayudara mucho a Juan Pablo y a su familia a tener mejores condiciones de vida, ya que su única fuente de ingreso económica es la agricultura, también indica que en las próximas oportunidades el realizara inversiones con créditos mayores que le permitan utilidades con mayor ingreso económicos.
texts.en:
Juan, 23, has two dependent children.  His wife is Ana, 22.  She helps with the agricultural work, taking the lead in the management of the family.  Juan and his wife had children very early, assuming a big responsibility when they were very young.  Juan Pablo and his family have scarce economic resources.

He worked in agriculture with his father from a very young age.  He even had to leave his studies to manage and run his parents' land, which they can no longer work like before because of their age.

Juan Pablo has a family to support and feed now, so he's requesting this loan to buy seeds and soil amendments to increase his crop and his income.

This loan will help Juan Pablo and his family a lot to have better living conditions, because agriculture is his only source of income.  He also says that in future opportunities he'll make investments with bigger loans that will give him profits and more income.

loans.use: to buy seed and soil amendments

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este comité es llamado (Sagrado Corazón de Jesús)  está en su primer ciclo ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, tienen muchas ganas de aprender y crecer. Ellas viven en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona bastante alejada, que dista a varios kilómetros de la ciudad. La mayoría de las miembros siempre recorren mucho para llegar a la ciudad y es muy sacrificado.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Andresa, quien cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtidita, donde tiene de todo para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montarlo y que hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela. También cuenta que le gustaría que su barrio vaya creciendo y que tengan un mejor acceso a la comunicación de la ciudad.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, carne, leche y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio con todo lo que necesitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Sagrado Corazón de Jesús (Sacred Heart of Jesus). They are on their first loan cycle and are learning to work together. They are very eager to learn and grow. They live in the city of Curuguaty, an area that is quite remote, being several kilometers from the city. Most of the members travel a long way to get to the city and it is very demanding. 

Andresa is one of the members. She has a small, well-stocked food store, where she has lots of things to offer her customers. She says that she was able to start it with a lot of effort and today she has a lot of customers. She also says that she would like for her neighborhood to grow and for the city to have better access to communication. She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, and more supplies to stock her business with everything her customers need.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, milk, and more.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 47-year-old Ruth from Bulawayo. She is widowed with three children, all attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. 

Ruth runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear . The business has been in operation for 19 years. She says the main challenge faced is competition from bigger retailers. 

Ruth has requested a loan of $500 to replenish stock for the coming winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase business capacity by opening more stalls as well as pay fees and rentals. In the future Ruth plans to open more stalls.	

Stock is bought outside the country where it is cheaper and sold locally at a profit, for example shoes bought for $1 will be sold at $4. The same applies to clothing.

loans.use: to order more clothing and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mahmoud appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Maysaa is a 26-year-old married young woman and a mother to three sons and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband is employed and gets low salary, which is not much enough to cover the family's needs.
Maysaa is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture for her children in order to improve their living conditions in the house. Taking this loan will offer to Maysaa's kids comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Felasteen

texts.en:
Felasteen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ahmad appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Felasteen is a 28-year-old young married woman and a mother to one son. Her husband is a worker who earns small salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.
The family has added a new room to their small house, but the amount of money they have is not enough to cover all the costs of making the final finish to this new room from installing tiles and adding cement to its walls and ceiling. Felasteen has took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover these costs. This will offer to Felasteen and her family suitable home condition and improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To purchase cement and tiles

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein who appears in the photo, is a 22-year-old single young man. He lives with his family in a small village near Jenin city and work with his family in agriculture mainly in planting olive trees.
Hussein wants to improve his living condition, so he took a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of buying new mobile phone to himself. Taking this loan will offer to Hussein new mobile phone so he can be in touch with his family and his friends and improve his living condition to better.

loans.use: To buy new mobile phone

loans.name: Saja

texts.en:
Saja who appears in the photo, is a 24-year-old married young woman. She is a lawyer and her husband is an accountant, both are getting low salaries which are not enough to cover all their needs and costs.
Saja is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer to Saja and her husband comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase new living room furniture

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 31-year-old single young man. For the past three years, Bilal has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him.
Bilal is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new engine to the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Bilal to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve his income positively.
Bilal has the photo next to his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase new engine to the taxi

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 19-year-old single young man. For the past one year, Karam has been operating an electronics repairs workshop, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also not enough to cover his cost of living.
Karam is requesting a 1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new electronics repair kit. This will improve Karam's work quality and increase demand from his customers to repair their electronics such as washing machines and Air conditions. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions. Karam is photographed in the workshop.

loans.use: To buy new electronics repair kit

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy runs rental houses business in Nairobi's Eastlands area.She has been in this business for the past 13 years and it has been profitable.She is 54 years old,widowed and has three children.

This is her second loan term and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more building materials for construction of more rental houses.These include cement,iron sheets and sand.She will use the anticipated profits to buy another plot and build more rental houses.

She hopes to build a residential house for her family,build commercial buildings for renting and make more income so as to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy building material for construction.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 64 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children. 

Perlita is engaged in 'viand' and snack vending activity and earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Perlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth,now 29 years old,married and with one child,used her previous loan amount to buy stock of shoes and clothes for sell in her boutique business.It was profitable and she was able to pay back all the loan amount.

This will be her third loan and she plans to buy more stock of shoes and  fabric materials for making dresses for sell.This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers as well as make more profits with which she plans to pay school fees for her child.

In future,Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and open another boutique business.

loans.use: To buystock of shoes and  fabric materials.

loans.name: Albena

texts.en:
Albena is a cash crop farmer in Oloitoktok town where she plants maize,beans and vegetables for sell.She is 37 years old,widowed and has four children.She has been in this farming business for five years and it has been profitable.

This being her second loan term,she plans to use the loan amount to buy vegetable seedlings,maize seeds, fertilizer and farm chemicals for use in her farm.She hopes to generate more profits with which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her farming business,make more income and be able to provide good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James used his previous loan amount to purchase firewood for sell in his firewood selling business.It was profitable and he was able to pay all the loan amount.Besides the firewood business,James has a bicycle repair business in the same area.He also sells bicycle spare parts to various bicycle users.

This being his third loan term,he plans to use the loan amount to buy bicycle spare parts for sell and use in his business.He also plans to use part of the loan amount to buy more stock of firewood for sell in his firewood business.

He hopes to grow both the bicycle repair and firewood businesses and make more income hence,be able to provide good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts for sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret,51 years of age,has a vegetable selling business in Nairobi's Eastlands area.She also sells tomatoes,onions and fish and has been in this business for the past eight years.She is widowed and has three children.

This will be her second loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan amount to buy vegetables such as cabbages,kale's and spinach for sell.She also plans to buy tomatoes,onions and fish for sell.This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers and thereby make more profit with which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and open a grocery store at the market place and thereby make more income so as to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes,onions and fish for sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 43 years old,married and has three children.She does farming in Makueni town where she plants cash crops and fruits for sell.These include maize,beans vegetables and mangoes.She has been in this farming business for 12 years and it has been profitable.

This will be her second loan term and she plans to use the loan amount to buy farm equipments such as spraying machines for spraying chemicals on crops as well as pruning tools.She also plans to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her farming business by planting more cash crops and thereby make more income.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and  equipments for use.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth,now 31 years of age,used her previous loan amount to buy rice,cow peas and beans for sell in her cereals business.It was profitable and she was able to pay all the loan amount.Besides the cereals business,she has a food stall from which she sell french fries and it has also been profitable.

This being her second loan term with KADET LTD,she plans to use the loan amount to buy potatoes for cooking the french fries.She also plans to buy charcoal for use.She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to open a cafe in the area which will enable her make more income and thereby be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and charcoal.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 49 years old. He lives in Sachkhere district with his wife, sister, 24 year old son and 22 year old daughter. Nodar requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
The main source of the income for the family is Nodar’s son’s monthly salary. He is an artisan and works on house constructions and renovations. Nodar’s sister is an invalid and she gets monthly pension from the local government institutions. Family monthly income is so small that it’s hardly enough to cover their food expenses. 
Nodar requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Nodar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Nodar will start trading with clothes. He will go to Turkey for purchasing clothes at the wholesale price, bring it to his district and resell among the villager with the price markup.  Nodar’s daughter will help him in this business and they will work as hard as they can to earn good profit and expand the business. Increased income will significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start trading with clothes from Turkey

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Living in Batumi district Irakli is 29 years old married men. He lives with his wife, mother and brother. Irakli requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Everyone in the family works on a small monthly salaries. Irakli is a distributor in a gas company. His wife is a teacher in a kindergarten, mother is a cleaner at the local beauty salon and brother is an artisan, working on renovations.  Their total income is rarely enough to cover the monthly expenses and have proper food products to eat. 
Irakli requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Irakli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Irakli will renovate the top floor in the house. He wants to start renting out their current living space seasonally on tourist. The family will move to live in the newly renovated garret and after renting their living space will be able to earn an additional income. Increased income will help them to cover all the monthly expenses and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To renovate the garret in the house

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 43 years old,married and has three children.She is a farmer in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops such as maize,beans,vegetables and bananas for sell and it has been profitable.She also does dairy farming from which she supplies milk to various retail shops in the area.

This is her first loan term and she plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs for use in her farm.These include fertilizer,seeds and feeds for her dairy cows.She anticipates to make more income with which she will be able to provide for the needs of her family.

She hopes to improve her farming methods and become one of the best farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs for use in her farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
59 years old David lives in the a small village of Chiatura district, Tsasri with his 59 year old wife Neli and 92 year old mother Nina. David requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a vineyard and an agricultural plot of land. David cultivates the land seasonally and sows different kinds of vegetables. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets. Family additional income is David’s mother’s monthly pension.  
David requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. David has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit David will purchase a milk cow. Neli will be milking the cow every day and producing dairy products. It will be sold together will the harvested products among the villagers and at the local markets. This will help David to earn good profit, which he wants to use for expanding his agricultural business and renovating their house to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and produce dairy products

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic,39 years of age,has a retail shop in Thika road area in Nairobi town which he has been running for the past nine years and it has been profitable.He is married to Susan who runs a grocery store and they have three children.

This will be his tenth loan term from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of goods for sell.These include sugar,rice,cooking fat,flour as well as detergents. He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods for sell.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a cash crop farmer in Makueni town where he plants maize,beans and potatoes for sell.He also plants fruits and vegetables which he supplies to various towns.He is 31 years old,married and has one child.

This is his first loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy a water pump and be able to irrigate and water his crops.He also plans to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.He anticipates to make more income from the sell of his farm produce and he will use the profits to pay school fees for his child.

He hope to improve his farming methods and become one of the leading farmers in the area as well as make more income.

loans.use: To buy  water pump and fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old. He lives in the small village of Sachkhere District with his wife, two sons and parents, who are provided with a retirement pension. George requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.7 hectare plot of land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Besides they have 6 milking cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. They sell the harvested products with dairy products at local markets at a good price. It is hardly enough on food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

George requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit George will begin trade with livestock. He plans to purchase the livestock at wholesale prices and then resell at higher price. This will increase the income of his family. With increased income, he will be able to expand the business in future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trade with the livestock

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a school teacher and owns a kindergarten school in Oloitoktok town.She has run the school for three years now and she's proud to provide education to the children in the area.She is 27 years old,married to Joseph who supports the family with his business income and they have two children. 

This is Judy's first loan term from KADET LTD and she plans to buy school stationary such as books,files,chalks,charts, and pencils.She also plans to buy chairs and desks.This will enable the children to have enough material for learning.

She hopes to build a primary school in the area and employ more teachers.

loans.use: To buy school stationary such as books and files.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years old, married, and a mother of three children. For the last thirteen years, she has earned a living by selling household items in Mpeketoni; Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES.20, 000.

Nancy is applying for her third loan of KES. 50,000, additional stock, such as new basins, lighting lamps, water buckets and such other items to sell to her clients. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as continue expanding her business. 

Nancy's goal for the future is to own a well-established general store in the area, so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias still does farming and also a driver of a public service vehicle. His farming business is doing extremely well especially after the previous loan.  

He is requesting for a second business loan to purchase farm inputs i.e seedlings, fertilizers. He will use the anticipated profits from the business to cater for his children's school fees. 

He still harbors the dream of owning a public vehicle one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs i.e seedlings, fertilizers

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John runs a taxi business in Thika road area of Nairobi.He is 43 years old,married and has three children.He has been in this taxi business 10 years and it has been profitable.

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy spare parts and service his taxi.This will enable him to keep it in good condition.He anticipates to make more income with which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

John hopes to grow his business and buy more cars for taxi business and even own a taxi company.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his car.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 50 years old mother from Kakamega county she supports five people in the family and married to Newton who is a farmer and supports family, she has five children who are 20, 18, 15, 13 and eight years old respectively.

She sells grocery which she has been doing for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000; she has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to become outstanding business person in the area and to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Fahema

texts.en:
Fahema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Fahema is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband and her eldest son are workers inside the border, both of them get small salaries that are barely enough to cover the family's needs. Fahema and her family live in a small village called Rantees near Ramallah, they live in a small modest and old house that needs repair.
Fahema is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of repairing her house such as installing new tiles, painting and installing new doors and windows.
Taking this loan will create to Fahema and her family suitable home conditions, which will improve their lives positively.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Ignatus

texts.en:
Ignatus is 30 years old man from Kakamega county, he is still single man who supports three people in their family.
 
He has a Barber shop which has been operating for the last two years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000, he is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase a modern machines and add chairs, he will use the anticipated profit to start a new business.

His dream is to start a new business and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a modern machines and add chairs

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 42 years old a business lady. She is married to Nasir and together they are blessed with four children. Zainab has been selling second hand clothes for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Zainab is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET client. She will use the loan to purchase shirts,trousers, skirts and wrappers for sale.With the anticipated profit from the business, she will start saving for her children’s school fees and plough the remaining amount back into the business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a good stable business in order to keep her plans moving on well.

loans.use: to purchase shirts,trousers, skirts and wrappers

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is 51 years old. She lives Utsera village, Oni district with her husband Koba, retired parents’ in-law and three children (8, 17 and 21 years old). Luiza requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and plot of agricultural land, where nut trees and vegetables are grown. Luiza milks the cows every day to produce dairy products, which are sold at the local markets together with harvested products. Koba is a war veteran and gets a military pension. Family additional income is Koba’s parent’s monthly pensions. 
Luiza requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Luiza has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Luiza will open two grocery shops. She has a space in the house and also owns a commercial cabin in the center of her village. Luiza wants to purchase grocery stock and use both spaces as a shop. Family will work long hours in both shops. It will bring a good profit, which will be reinvested in the same field.  Luiza will expand her business and earn a good income. With the increased income she will be able to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks and open two gorcery shops

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 34 years old lady from Kakamega town within western part of Kenya, she is married to Nawate who is a businessman and has three school children.

She has a Beauty Salon within her local town, she has been operating this kind of business for the last three years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 15,000, she is taking her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase blow drier and cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

Her dream is to grow her business and become a successful entrepreneur so as to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase equipments

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 23 years old lady, Kakamega County which is located in the western part of Kenya, she is married to Oscar who also supports family by providing income and they have no children.

She has a retail shop which has been operating for the last two years and generates a monthly income of KES. 25,000 to the family, she has applied for her first loan  from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to boost her stock. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to live a better and support the needy.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to boost her stock

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 49 years old. She lives in Batumi district with her husband and son. Nona requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
The only source of the income for the family is from the Georgian bread bakery.  They are baking the bread and sell it from the bakery to earn small daily income, which is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses. 
Nona requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Nona has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Nona will purchase a car and also renovate the bakery. With the new car Nona will start distributing the bread at the local shops and increase the sales quantity. As the bakery is already well known for the local people Nona will have good numbers of shops to distribute the bread. It will significantly expand her business and increase the profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will help Nona to provide better living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a car and also renovate the bakery

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
29 years old Givi lives in Kobuleti district with his 25 year old wife, mother and two children (2 and 5 years old). Givi requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Give is a mini-bus driver and works for a shop that sells fruits and vegetables to earn small income for the family. Also his mother is trading with clothes. She buys at the wholesale price from the big market in the capital city and resells them among the villagers. 
Givi requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Givi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Givi will purchase stocks of vegetables to start trading. He will by the products at the wholesale price from the resellers to sell it with the price markup at the local market, where he already has his own counter. Givi is already experienced in this field. He will earn a profit and use it for reinvesting and purchasing more verities of vegetables in order to expand the business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start trading with vegetables

loans.name: Guman

texts.en:
Guman is 66 years old retired man. He lives in Tlughi village Ambrolauri district with his 59 year old wife. Guman requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milk cows, 3 pigs and plot of agricultural land, where potatoes and nut trees are grown. The cows are milked every day to produce dairy products. Family sells meat and the harvested products together with dairy products at the local markets to earn small monthly income. 
Guman requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Guman has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Guman will build a small building for drying the cones. This particular cone is the special type, which only grows in Ambrolauri region and is used for medicines.  After collecting the cones Guman will dry and then hack them and get it ready for sales. It will be exported in the nearby countries where this product is highly requested. As not many people are busy with this business in the region Guram will earn a good profit and significantly increase the family income. With the increased income he will be able to have better life together with his wife.

loans.use: To build a small building for drying the cones

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
39 years old Irakli lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi with his 28 year old wife Nato. Irakli requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
The only source of the income for the family is from the Georgian bread bakery. Irakli bakes the bread, which is sold from the bakery and in nearby shops. 
Irakli requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Irakli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Irakli will renovate the bakery and purchase more materials. He wants to expend the business. After renovation Irakli will add more inventories, which will give him an opportunity to bake more bread and increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To renovate the bakery and purchase more materials

loans.name: Ketino

texts.en:
Ketino is 39 years old. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi with her 27 year old sister and 16 year old daughter. Ketino requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
Ketino has a grocery shop and earns daily income. Also her sister is a dentist, working at the local dentist clinic and earns small monthly salary.
Ketino requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Ketino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Ketino will purchase grocery stocks for her grocery shop. Her shop is already well known at the neighborhood and Ketino wants to expand the stock, in order to offer better choice of products to her clients. This will increase the sales number and Ketino will be able to earn better profit. Part of the profit she will reinvest in the same business and purchase more verities of products. Another part will be used to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for her grocery shop

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
29 years old Akaki lives in Zestaponi district with his 22 year old wife, parents and retired grandparents. Akaki requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have two milk cows, a vineyard and plot of land, where different vegetables are grown. Harvested products with the dairy products are sold at the local markets and among the villagers. Family additional income is Akaki’s grandparent’s monthly pensions which totally is 250 Gel.
Akaki requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. Akaki has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Akaki will purchase a car from abroad at the low cost. He will transport it to Georgia and sell with the price mark up to earn a profit. Part of the profit he will reinvest in the same field to continue working with the car sales. Another part he will add to the family monthly income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a car from abroad for resale

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина замужняя женщина и мать пятерых детей. Она проживает в городе Куляб. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках за пределами страны. Сама Заррина тоже трудится и обеспечивает семью. Вот уже 6 лет как она занимается торговлей. На рынке города у нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает детскую одежду. В бизнесе ей помогает ее старший сын. Заррина закупает свой товар в месяц 4-раза с оптового рынка города Душанбе, привозит в Куляб и продает на рынке по розиночной цене. Заррина очень любит свой торговый бизнес, так как получает хороший доход. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Заррина обратилась за кредитом. Она просит кредит для закупа сезонной детской одежды.
texts.en: Zarrina is a married woman and a mother of five children.  She lives in the city of Kulob.  Her husband is currently working abroad.  Zarrina also works and provides for the family.  She has been involved in sales for six years.  She has a retail outlet at the city market, where she sells children's clothing.  Her oldest son helps her with the business.  Zarrina buys her goods from a wholesale market in Dushanbe four times per month, brings them to Kulob and sells at a retail price.  Zarrina loves her retail business very much because she earns a good income.  Zarrina requested this loan to increase goods turnover.  She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete building the house

loans.name: Marlene Maclovia

texts.es:
La Señora. Marlene vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca que es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999. Forma parte del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz desde hace 10 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a formar parte de un hermoso grupo de mujeres todas ellas guerreras que desean mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares.

Doña Marlene tiene 54 años, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos son casados viven independientes, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora Marlene es comerciante, se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, esta actividad la realiza puerta a puerta vendiendo a sus amigas y conocidas, también tiene una tienda de víveres en la cual trabaja a diario sin horario.

Su crédito va ha invertir en la compra de cosméticos y víveres para su tienda.

Su meta es de comprarse un vehículo para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene lives in the area of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca, which has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999. She has been part of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank for ten years. In this time, she has become part of a beautiful group of women, all of whom are warriors who wish to improve the stability of their homes.

Marlene, 54, is a single mother of six adult children, three of whom are married and live independently. Her three single children work and help her financially. She does not have her own house, so she rents. 

Marlene is a merchant who sells cosmetics door-to-door to her friends and acquaintances. She also has a grocery store, in which she works daily without a fixed schedule.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of cosmetics and groceries for her store. Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and groceries.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 32-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two daughters. Since 2000, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. Nadia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hard working and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Neida Margoth

texts.es:
La Señora Neida se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda una rica historia al igual que la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente aun mantienen vivas su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora Neida tiene 31 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos, uno de 5 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la localidad y su segundo hijo de apenas 11 meses de edad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Neida se dedica la venta de huevos de codorniz cocidos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace algún tiempo y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

 Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una nueva carreta para su negocio y huevos de codorniz para la venta.

 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Neida’s in her second loan with the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women with Vision) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a rich history as well as beautiful colonial architecture.  Its cuisine is a delight for locals and foreigners alike.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Neida, 31, lives in a common law relationship and has had two children, a five-year-old attending a little local school and her second son who is just 11-months-old.  Her husband’s a merchant.  They don’t own a house, they are renters.

Neida works selling cooked quail eggs, an activity she’s been doing for some time now; she works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She will use her loan to buy a new cart for her business and quail eggs to sell.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy a cart and quail eggs.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora. Bertha se encuentra realizando su cuarto crédito en el banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, le gusta la banca comunal porque en cada reunión  se encuentra con sus amigas y sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda una rica historia al igual que la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente aun mantienen vivas su cultura y tradiciones. 

La Señora. Bertha tiene 33 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 17, 15, 8 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo pasa en casa, su segunda hija aunque es muy joven es casada y vive independiente, su tercer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Bertha se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa, joyas, cosméticos y más productos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace algunos años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa, joyas y cosméticos.

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Bertha’s in her fourth loan with the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women with Vision) communal bank.  She likes her communal bank because she meets with her girlfriends at every meeting and gets out of her daily work routine.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a rich history as well as beautiful colonial architecture.  Its cuisine is a delight for locals and foreigners alike.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Bertha’s 33-year-old, married and has had four children who are 17, 15, 8 and 2 years of age.  Her oldest son stays home, her second daughter is married even though she’s very young and lives independently.  Her third son is attending the local little school.  Her husband works in commerce.  She does not own a house; she’s a renter.

Bertha works selling clothes, jewelry, cosmetics and other products from place to place.  She’s been doing this for several years and works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, jewelry and cosmetics.  Her goal is to have a locale of her own in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 56 years old  business lady. She is a widowed mother of three grown up children. She has been knitting sweaters for sell for the past eight years with a monthly income of KES 6,000. She also sells groceries to supplement her income. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET client. She will use the loan to buy threads and knitting needles. With the anticipated income from the business, she intends to plough it back into the business. 

Agnes’ hopes and dreams are to expand her knitting business and increase customer base for her grocery business.

loans.use: to buy threads and knitting needles

loans.name: Kuntora

texts.en:
Kuntora is 47 years old. He is married and a father of four children aged between five and fifteen. He has been farming his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.He learned about KADET from women who are already registered members of KADET LTD. 

This will be his seventh loan after paying back the previous loans successfully. He plans to spend the loan amount to prepare land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm.  Because of the climatic condition and fertile soil, wheat has proved to do very well and also the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers. 

Kuntora hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is do large-scale farming and have his own farm machinery.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare the land

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old a business lady. She is a married mother of four school going children. Jane has been selling second hand clothes for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Jane is applying for her second loan term  from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. Jane  will use the loan to purchase shirts, skirts, trousers and sweaters.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will start investing for her children’s school fees and plough the remaining amount back into the business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a good stable business in order to keep improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, skirts, trousers and sweaters

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old man from Mumias in Bungoma county which is located in western part of Kenya, he is married to Mwenesi who is a business-lady, he supports four people in the family and has three children who are; 13, 11 and three years old respectively.

He practices dairy farming,and he has been doing this for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES. 15,000, he has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase one more dairy cow, he will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

His dream is to become large scale dairy farmer and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 59 years old mother from Kakamega region which is located in the western part of Kenya, she is married to Jackson who is a farmer and was blessed with three children who are; 23, 20 and 16 years old respectively.

She has a tailoring stall which has been operating for the last nine years and generates a monthly income of Kes. 7,500, she is taking her third loan from  KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase plain fabric materials, she will use the anticipated profit to expand the current business.

Her dream is to expand her business and educate their children.

loans.use: To purchase plain fabric materials.

loans.name: Sellina

texts.en:
Selina is 57 years old mother from Vihiga region which is located in the western part of Kenya married to Elliam who is a businessman and has seven children who are 35, 30, 26, 22, 18, 14 and eight years old respectively.

She has a food kiosk which has been in operating for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000, she is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more tables and plastics seats, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more tables and plastics seats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To paint the house and install tiles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old married to Fredrick who contributes to the family income. She has been selling cereals for a period of about three years with an income of KES. 25,000.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy more stock of assorted cereals for sale. She hopes to educate her children to the highest level and buy dairy cattle in order to supply milk in the area.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  cereals for sale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria's business of poultry rearing is doing extremely well. She has also ventured into hotel business after receiving financial support from KADET LTD. She is requesting for her fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

She intends to use the loan to purchase a fryer double tank to be used in the hotel. She will use the proceeds from the business to purchase more chicks to rear in her farm. 

Her hopes and dreams are to see her hotel grow into a five star hotel.

loans.use: to purchase a fryer double tank

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a woman of thirty one years, married to Joseph Kiarie and a mother of two children, she is a dressmaker and has been in this business for five years now, she gets monthly income of twelve thousand shillings.

This will be Sarah's second loan term and she plans to use the entire loan to buy new materials for making clothes. In future she wants to be a successful tailor and employ people to work for her.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 41 years old man from Homabay town which is found in Nyanza province, he is married and supports seven people in his family, he has four children who are, 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old respectively.

He has a retail shop which has been operating for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES. 10,000, he has applied for his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase maize flour and any other shop items in bulk, and he will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

His dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: To purchase Maize flour and any other shop items

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 29 years old married and supports six people, he runs an Electronic retail shop and a general merchandise retail shop in Kapsabet town.He has been in these business for the last two years of which he gets a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD and he intends to purchase stock for his retail shop e.g sugar, salt, wheat flour, maize flour, bar soaps, washing powder among other items.

He anticipates getting profit of which he will use to expand his business as well as save for future use.
His dream is to expand his business to a chain of supermarkets.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories, power cables, extension cords, electric bulbs, and fuses.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old man from Homabay county which is located in the western part of Kenya, he is a married to Benter who is a farmer, he supports nine people in his family and was blessed with three children who are, 24, 20 and 16 years old respectively.

He sells grains a business he has been doing for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000, he is taking his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more grains, he will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has a dream of becoming a successful businessman and supports his family.

loans.use: To purchase more Maize, Beans and millet.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad who appears in the photo, is a 27-year-old single young man. Mohammad has had a barber shop, which is a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also not much enough to cover all his needs.
Mohammad has took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new mobile phone to his personal use. Taking this loan will offer to Mohammad new mobile phone, so he will be in contact with his family and his clients, which will improve his living condition.
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To buy new mobile phone

loans.name: Baslisa

texts.en:
Baslisa is a single lady of forty seven years, she is a single mother of five children. She sells grocery in Kangemi and has been in this business for thirteen years, she gets monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Baslisa's first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy more grocery like onion, tomatoes, fruits, potatoes etc.In future she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes etc for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a twenty seven year old lady, she is a single mother of two children, she sells used shoes for children and grown ups and also sells new suits for men, she has been in this business for seven years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Margaret's first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy shoes for resale. In future she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase official and casual shoes for resale

loans.name: Roshdi

texts.en:
Roshdi is a 21-year-old single young man, he lives with his family a modest simple life in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza. For the past two years, Roshdi has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also needs more support to cover the costs.
Roshdi is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him complete the price of purchasing a taxi for his own. This will enable Roshdi to work extra hours and to take additional internal and external requests,  which will improve his income positively.
Roshdi has the picture in front of his taxi.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing the taxi

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 26 years old man from in Vihiga County, he supports two people in the family and is married to Doreen who is a business lady, he has one child who is two years old.

He has Boutique where he sells new clothes and new shoes, he has been operating this business for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES. 25,000, he is taking his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase new clothes at a wholesale price for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to start a new business.

His dream is to open another business and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a man of twenty five years, married to Hannah, they have no children yet, Wilson runs a money transfer business (M-PESA) in Kangemi and has been in this business for three years now, he gets monthly income of fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Wilson's first loan with KADET LTD, he plans to put the entire money in his business float for M-PESA. In future he wants to open another shop for M-PESA.

loans.use: To add to business float

loans.name: Boshra

texts.en:
Boshra is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Kamal appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture in the kitchen of their house.
Boshra is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed at the Ministry of Education who earns small salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.
Boshra wants to improve her house's kitchen condition, so she is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing and installing marble stone shelves to the kitchen.
This will make Boshra's movement in the kitchen more easier and fullfill her needs , which will improve her family's living condition positively.
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To install marble stone shelves to the kitchen

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past one year, Mohammad has had a cosmetics store located in a distinguished commercial area of the market where there is a good customers movement and has a lot of loyal clients. His project is considered to be a profitable one and the only source of income to him, but also needs from time to time some support to cover urgent needs and costs.
Mohammad is requesting a USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing additional new cosmetics that his customers often like and buy. This will allow him to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase his income positively.
Mohammad has the photo in his cosmetics store.

loans.use: To buy new collection of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en:
Yehia who appears in the photo, is a 26-year-old engaged young man, he is employed and earns small salary that is not much enough to cover all his wedding expenses.
Yehia prepares to get marry soon in this Summer, he has amount of money but not enough to cover all his necessary wedding expenses, so he is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture. Taking this loan will offer to Yehia comfortable furniture so he can enjoy living in his house with his coming wife.
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 25-year-old single young man, his father is employed and gets low salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.
For the past two years, Mustafa has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.
Mustafa is requesting a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and milk. This will increase sales and increase Mustafa's income.
Mustafa has the photo in the grocery store he has.

loans.use: To purchase needed stock of basic groceries

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud who appears in the photo, is a 25-year-old engaged young man. He is employed and gets small salary, which is not much enough to cover all his wedding expenses.
Mahmoud has took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture.
Taking this loan will offer to Mahmoud comfortable and suitable bedroom furniture, so he will be ready to get marry soon and enjoy living in his house with his coming wife.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Moen

texts.en:
Moen who appears in the photo, is a 19-year-old single young man, he lives with his family in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza. His mother earns small pension, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
Moen is a university student, specializing in interior Design, who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Moen to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Moen and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new laptop

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel is a 50-year-old married man and a father to two sons and one daughter. 
For the past five years, Nabeel has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but also needs more support to cover some necessary costs.
Nabeel is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new engine to the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi capacity to work extra hours and enable Nabeel to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.
Nabeel has the photo next to his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase new engine to the taxi

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Majed appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Amani is a 28-year-old married young woman and a mother to one son. Amani is a housewife and her husband Majed is a worker who earns small salary, which is barely enough to cover their needs.
Amani lives with her family in a small old house that needs some necessary repairs such as painting and changing new windows. Amani has took a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of painting the house and installing new windows. Taking this loan will offer to Amani and her family suitable home condition so they can enjoy living in their small house.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad who appears in the picture, is a 20-year-old single young man, he lives with his family in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza. His mother earns small pension, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
Mohammad is a university student, specializing in Civil Engineering, who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Mohammad to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Mohammad and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase laptop

loans.name: Waad

texts.en:
Waad is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Waad is a 23-year-old married young woman and a mother to one son and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband is a worker in a bakery who gets small salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.
Waad lives with her family in a small modest house in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza, she has took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing curtains and sponge mats in order to improve living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will enable Waad and her to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase sponge mats and curtains

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old single young man, he lives with his family in a small village which is famous of raising sheep and cows and planting olive trees, Ahmad's father is a merchant cows from a long time.
For the past four years, Ahmad has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover costs.
Ahmad is requesting a 1,200 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve his income.
Ahmad has the photo inside the herd where he is raising sheep.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep to expand the project

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad who appears in the photo, is a 27-year-old married young man and a father to one son. For the past one year, Ahmad has had a shoe stall, he has been selling different types and sizes of shoes that clients often request and buy. His stall located in a good commercial area in the market where there is a good customers movement. His project is a profitable one and the only source of income to him, but also needs more support to cover some costs.
Ahmad is requesting a 1,500 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new collection of different types and sizes of men, women and kids shoes to sell.
This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income positively.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 25-year-old single young man. he lives with his family in Tubas Village and he works in agriculture with the rest of the family members. For the past two years, Shadi has had a greenhouse planting different types of vegetables, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but also still needs more support to cover some costs.
Shadi is requesting a 3,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing tomato seedlings. It will allow Shadi to produce a better crop and thus increase his sales and improve the family's income.
Shadi is photographed inside the greenhouse while he is collecting tomato crop to sell.

loans.use: To purchase tomato seedlings

loans.name: Libia Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Libia forma parte del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que es conocida por ser la cuna de grandes poetas y escritores, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999. El banco comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que encontró en todas sus amigas y conocidas. 

Doña Libia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y no ha concebido hijos, su esposo es un profesional y ejerce la Abogacía, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora. Libia trabaja a diario en su restaurante, lleva en el negocio desde hace 8 años, como le gusta mucho el arte culinario decidió tener su propio negocio y ahora percibe ingresos a diario, es su propio jefe y trabaja a su ritmo. 

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres de los cuales obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Con su nuevo crédito va a comprar víveres y gaseosas para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Libia is part of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known as the birthplace of great poets and writers. It has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999. She likes the communal bank because of the sense of community she has found in her friends and acquaintances.

Libia, 48, is married with no children. Her husband is a legal professional. They live in their own house.

Libia works daily in her restaurant. She has been in this business for eight years. Since she likes the culinary arts, she decided to start her own business and she now makes a daily income. She is her own boss and she works at her own pace.

She used her previous loan to invest in the purchase of food, with which she had very good earnings. With her new loan, she will buy food and soft drinks to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy food and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jova Germania

texts.es:
La Señora Jova está realizando su segundo crédito en el banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, en este corto tiempo ha logrado establecer muy buena relación de amistad con todas las integrantes de este hermoso grupo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  guarda una rica historia al igual que la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente aun mantienen vivas su cultura y tradiciones. 

La Señora Jova tiene 50 años, está separada de su marido pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 16 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y su última hija está en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
