La Señora Jova es oriunda de Babahoyo y hace 30 años llego a esta ciudad para realizar sus estudios universitarios, desde hace 5 años tiene una tienda de víveres y en ella trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en sociedad con su hermana. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para surtir aun más su tienda. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Jova’s in her second loan with the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women with Vision) communal bank.  In this short period of time she’s managed to establish a good friendship with all the members of this beautiful group.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a rich history as well as beautiful colonial architecture.  Its cuisine is a delight for locals and foreigners alike.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Jova’s 50-years-old and separated from her husband but while married had three children who are 17, 16 and 9 years of age.  Her two oldest children attend a local high school and her youngest daughter attends the school.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Jova is originally from Babahoyo and came to this city 30 years ago to attend university.  She’s had a grocery store for the last five years and she works in it from Sunday to Sunday with no set schedule.  She also works selling cosmetics in partnership with her sister.

She will use the loan to buy groceries to better stock her store.  Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Erma has been in this business for 5 years. Erma earns more income from general store.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jerrin

texts.en:
Jerrin works hard to support her family. Jerrin is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jerrin requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

Jerrin has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Jerrin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Anna Katrina

texts.en:
Anna Katrina is 32 years old and married with four children.

Anna Katrina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

Anna Katrina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the selling dry goods for 10 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Anna Katrina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.en:
Teodocia is 57 years old and married with three children. Teodocia works very hard to provide for them.

Teodocia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like milk, snack foods, bread, soft-drinks, eggs, cream, etc. in her general store.

Teodocia has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, snack foods, bread, soft-drinks, eggs, cream, etc. 

Teodocia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like milk, snack foods, bread, soft-drinks, eggs, cream, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 54 years old and married with six children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items like can goods, milk, egg, spices, etc to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Veronica aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like can goods, milk, egg, spices, etc to sell

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school, Minda works very hard to provide for them.

Minda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, chips, noodles, can goods, etc to sell.

Minda has been in this business for four years.

In the future Minda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, chips, noodles, can goods, etc to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Adelina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Adelina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 61 old industrious lady, married and a mother of three children aged 14, 7 and 4. She buys and sells cereals in Bomet market. 

She learnt about KADET from one of our loan officers and decided to join. She has acquired her first loan of Kes 20,000 which she intends to purchase more cereals for resale at a gain. She will use the proceeds to put up a stall for the upcoming business.

Her hope is to raise the family living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 36 years old and married with one child.She does house rental business in Nairobi and she has been in this business for the past five years.

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy building materials for constructing more rental houses.These materials include building blocks,bags of cement and iron sheets as well as windows and door frames.She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her child.

In future Khadija hopes to buy a big plot and build both commercial and residential houses.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah has a tailoring business in Nairobi town.She has been in this business for the past five years and it has been profitable.She is 26 years old and married with three children.

This will be her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy an iron box,iron board,needles,threads,pairs of scissors and measuring tapes.She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business,make more income and open another tailoring shop.

loans.use: . to buy an iron box,iron board,needles,threads,pairs of scissors and measuring tapes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 56 year old business lady in Embu.  She is a single mother of one and she sells charcoal, a business she has done for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 8,800. 

She is applying for her first loan after she was introduced to KADET by an existing client.  She will use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She plans to use the proceeds from her business to plough back into the business and use the rest to invest in her child’s future. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land to construct a residential house.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 54 year old a business lady and a widowed mother of three. Virginia has been selling second hand clothes and shoes for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family. She also runs a tailoring business to supplement her income.

Virginia is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loan successfully. She  will use the loan to purchase clothes, shoes, and wrappers for resale and with the anticipated profit from the business, she will start investing for her children’s school fees and plough the remaining amount back into the business. 

Her dreams are to have a good stable business in order to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, and wrappers for resale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 72 years old and widowed with five children.

She earns a living by having a hog raising business in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 30 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 37 year old business man. He is married to Zipporah who is a mixed crop farmer and their marriage is blessed with two children, aged five and two years. He has been running a retail shop as his primary business and farming as his secondary business, with a monthly income of KES 7,400, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET and he will use the loan to buy sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps, cooking fat as additional stock for his retail shop and use the rest for his farming. With the anticipated profit from his businesses he intends to start a wholesale shop. 

His dreams are to buy a big piece of land for large scale faming.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, bar soaps, cooking fat as additional stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 50 years old and married with five children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, can goods, noodles, egg, spices, etc..

Lydia has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, can goods, noodles, egg, spices, etc.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a man of sixty one years, married to Hannah, they have one child who live with them and is in college the rest are adults. He does dairy farming and has been in this business for thirteen years, he gets a monthly income of twenty seven thousand  shillings.

This will be Samwel's sixth loan in KADET LTD, he has paid all other loans successfully, he plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In future he wants to educate and feed his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 23 years old married to Susan, they have one child. He practices farming in Ndunyu Njeru and also has a motorcycle business.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a dairy cow. He paid his previous loan on time.With anticipated profit he hopes to buy another cow.

He hopes to buy another motorbike in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 42 years old lady, married and a mother of four children aged between twenty and two years old. She is engaged in buying and selling of maize. 

She learned about KADET from a marketing campaign that was carried out in her market area then she joined. She has applied for her first loan of Kes 20,000 which will assist her to buy more maize for resale. She plans to use the proceeds to put up a stall.

Her dream is to successfully educate her children to higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a very hardworking 29 years old business woman. She is married to Kiplangat and supports a family of five members. She is involved in buying and selling maize in Bomet town. 

She learnt about KADET from other women in the market who are registered members. She has acquired her second loan of Kes 40,000 after successful paying off her previous loan. This will enable her to put up a stall for the business as she has been operating in the open air. The proceeds will be ploughed back for business expansion.

Her hope is to grow the business and educate her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: To put up a stall for her maize business

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
Bornes is a 53 old window and a mother of six children aged between thirty and twelve. She operates a small food cafe in the outskirts of Bomet County for that last two years making a monthly income of kes 18,000. 

She learnt about KADET from some of her clients who are registered members of KADET Limited. She has acquired her first loan of Kes 20,000 which she plans to replace some of the old furniture in the small hotel. She plans to use the proceeds to plough it back for business expansion.

loans.use: To renovate her food store

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Reham is a 25-year-old married young woman and a mother to two sons and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband is a worker who gets low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
Reham is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting her house and making some repairs such as installing new lights. This will ensure to Reham and her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To paint the house and make some repairs

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 29 years old, married and hard working lady who operates a tailoring shop. She is a mother of three children aged seven, three and one respectively.

She learnt about KADET from posters distributed in her area of work. She has acquired her first loan of kes 20000 which will facilitate her in the purchase of fabrics for dress making. She will use the proceeds to expand to dealing with cultural outfit in the quest of expanding the business.

She hopes to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for dress making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new and modern collection of mobile phones and its accessories to sell

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 42 year old mixed crop farmer and married to Susan a business lady with whom they are blessed with three children.  He has been practicing mixed crop farming for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family. He also operates as a driver of a public service vehicle to supplement his income.

Dominic is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He is glad and appreciates the financial support he has received from KADET and KIVA. His mixed crop farming is doing well. He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seedlings. With the anticipated profits from his farm, he will invest in his children’s education.  

His hopes are to purchase a bigger land for farming.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing the taxi

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a man of fifty seven years, married to Esther, he runs a butcher shop in Kangemi and has been doing so for thirteen years now, he gets monthly income of KES.20,000 which he uses to support the family.

This will be Benson's second loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire loan . In future he wants to feed and also provide for one of his daughters who lives with them.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, married to Robert and a mother of two. She runs a chemist in the outskirts of Bomet County. The chemist has been in operation for the past one earning her a monthly income of KES 94,000. 

She learnt about KADET from posters distributed at her area of operation. With her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET she intends to purchase additional drugs for resale as this will boost her purchasing power.

She intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. Her future plans is to become a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to purchase medical drugs for sale

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is forty years old, single and a mother of two lovely children, she runs a beauty salon in Kiambu and has been doing so for two years now and earns a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Faith's second loan with KADET LTD, she plans to get the entire loan to buy beauty products like hair shampoo, hair chemicals, hair oil etc. 


In future she wants to educate her children, and also be a prosperous salonist.

loans.use: To buy beauty products like hair oil,hair braids, shampoo etc

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 39-year-old married man and a father to three sons and five daughters all of them are below 18 years old. For the past eight years, Omar has been selling mobile phones to customers, his store located in a good commercial area in the market and has many loyal customers, which makes his project a profitable one and the only source of income to the family, but also needs more support to cover some costs.
Omar has took a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing additional new collection of mobile phones to sell. This will increase demand from his customers to buy new mobiles. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions. Omar is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase new collection of mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mobile phone

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a 33-year-old married young woman and a mother to two sons and one daughter, her husband is employed at the Ministry of Education who gets small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
For the past five years, Leena has had beauty salon, she has a good reputation a mong her customers and at the same time she has many loyal customers, which makes her project a profitable one.
Leena is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing air condition to her salon and purchasing new beauty salon kit such as different types of hair and body creams, hair brushes and dryers.
This will allow Leena to expand the scope of her work, improve her business, and increase the family's income.
Leena has the photo in her beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase air condition and new beauty salon kit

loans.name: Genny Elsa

texts.es:
En el sitio Rio Bravo de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquilla conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Bankito Rio Bravo.

En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 18, 14, 11, 8 y  6 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Doña Genny es una muy buena madre y esposa que con la finalidad de ayudar a su marido con la carga familiar realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas)  los mismos  que entrega a comerciantes para que los vendan en las construcciones de viviendas. Es así como el se gana el sustento y gracias a Dios nunca les ha faltado nada.

Este crédito es para comprar madera y tierra  para elaborar los ladrillos. Ella es fundadora  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos todos es más fácil para financiar el negocio de su marido.
  
Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In Rio Bravo de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional items like the straw sombreros that are famous both in and outside of the country, every 15 days the members of the Bankito Rio Bravo communal bank meet. 

Genny, who lives here, is 42 years old, married and has five children from this relationship aged 18, 14, 11, 8 and 6. The two eldest study in high school and the younger ones are at primary school. Her husband is an artesan.

Genny is a very good mother and wife who in order to help her husband with the family burden is taking out the loan for him to use in his work. He manufactures bricks (material used in the construction of houses) delivering them to retailers to sell them for house construction. This is how he earns a living and thanks to God has never wanted for anything.

This loan is to buy wood and earth to make bricks. She is founder at the communal bank and likes it because thanks to the loans everything is easier to finance her husband's business. 
  
His dream is that their children complete their education and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood and earth [to make bricks].

loans.name: Antonia Soraya

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia es una socia muy activa que forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, este banco comunal le gusta porque en cada reunión se encuentra con sus amigas y puede salir de su rutina diaria de trabajo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda una rica historia al igual que la belleza de su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente aun mantienen vivas su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Antonia tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 20, 16, 14, 10 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de 6 meses de nacido, dos de sus hijos trabajan, ayudan en los quehaceres del hogar y estudian, uno estudia en el colegio y otro en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Antonia se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en un pequeño local que tiene y también vende cosméticos, estas actividades le permiten mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y sacar adelante a toda su familia.

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para su negocio del cual obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que necesita comprar víveres, mesas y sillas para mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Antonia’s a very active member of the “Mujeres con Visión” (Women with Vision) communal bank.  She likes this communal bank because at each meeting she meets with her girlfriends and she can get out of her daily work routine.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a rich history as well as beautiful colonial architecture.  Its cuisine is a delight for locals and foreigners alike.  Its people still keep their culture and traditions alive.

Antonia is 41-years-old, married and has had five children who are 20, 16, 14, and 10 years of age; her youngest is 6-months-old.  Two of her children work, help with household chores and study; one in high school and the other one in the local little school.  Her husband works as a private employee.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Antonia works making and selling food in a small locale she has; she also sells cosmetics.  These activities make it possible for her to improve her household’s economic stability and move her entire family forward.

She used her previous loan to buy foodstuffs for her business and earned good profits from them.  She’s repeating the loan because she needs to buy foodstuffs, tables and chairs to improve her locale.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ruth Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth esta realizando su primer crédito en el banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Ruth tiene 49 años, es casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo se dedica al comercio, la casa en la que vive es propia.

La Señora Ruth se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de muebles y ropa para lo cual tiene un local, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

Su crédito es para comprar ropa para surtir más su local. 

Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Ruth is taking out her first loan with the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (A Future for Well-Being).  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that safeguards its history and keeps its colonial architecture intact.  The city’s cuisine is varied and delights the palates of its visitors.  Its people are kind, courteous and keep their culture and traditions alive.

Ruth is 49-years-old, married and has no children.  Her husband works in commerce.  The house she lives in is hers.

For the last 20 years Ruth has been working selling furniture and clothes for which she has a locale.  She works Monday through Saturday with no fixed schedule.  Her loan is to buy clothes to better stock her store.  Her dream is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and married with four children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Editha has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising livestock.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marevilla

texts.en:
Marevilla is 36 years old and has three children. Marevilla is married and has three children who are in school.

Marevilla is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marevilla requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marevilla has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marevilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess is 30 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maritess is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maritess has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is forty nine year old hardworking man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.He has been running a diary farm since 1985 a long side crop production to boost his family income.He has a vision of having a big farm and educating his children to higher levels of learning although like any another farmer,he is faced with hardships of unpredictable weather change.John intends to use the loan to buy six rolls of barbed wire, poles and pay workers.

loans.use: to buy six rolls of barbed wire, poles and pay workers.

loans.name: Kansiime

texts.en: Sauda is a thirty year old hard working woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.She is a farmer and does brick making as a side business to boost her income.Her vision is educating her children to higher levels while her business plan is to expand to new areas despite challenge of unpredictable weather change that hider her production.Sauda will use the loan to buy materials for brick making and pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy materials for brick making and pay laborers.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a twenty six year old married man living in Fort portal, Uganda.He practices farming and also has a motorcycle transport business.He is faced with a challenge of limited funds to run his businesses although he has a business desire to own at least three motorcycles since the business is very lucrative.John will use the loan to buy another motorcycle which he intends to hire to another rider who will remit 80% of daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy another motorcyle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a widow parent of one child, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Victoria is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 34 years old and married with one child.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, bread, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store.

Analiza has been in this business for 4 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.


Analiza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional  items to sell like shampoo, bread, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Ma. Nida is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 34 years old and has one child. Editha is married and has one child who is in school.

Editha is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Editha has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a fifty eight year old married man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming and also runs a retail shop to boost his income. However, unpredictable weather changes affect his business yet his vision is becoming a model farmer and also educating his children to higher levels of learning. William intends to use the loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation by buying fertilizers and mulching.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation by buying fertilizers and mulching

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a twenty nine year old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.He has been selling shoes since 2006 and also does farming as a side business to increase his income. With the proceeds he has been able to educate his children up to the University.Unpredictable weather change mostly the rainy season affect his business since he operates from the open while his vision is to increase his monthly income by diversifying business. Robert will use the loan to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is twenty seven year old married man with one child living in Fort portal, Uganda.For the past four years he has been farming but he also works as a hired motorcycle rider who has to remit 80% of the daily earnings to his boss. He is faced with a challenge of lack of enough capital yet from his little savings, he has educated his child.His dream is to buy his own motorcycle.Roger is requesting for a loan to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.use: to buy  motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Medius

texts.en: Medius is a thirty four year old married lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For fifteen years she is been dealing in second hand clothes although like any other trader, she is faced with a challenge of  unpredictable weather changes especially the rainy seasons which badly affect her movements. However, she has managed to pay fees for her children with the profits and she dreams of buying a plot to build a home. Medius intends to use the loan to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes to sell..

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en: Doviko is a sixty four year old man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.For thirty years he has been  farming along side running a retail business and he has been able to educate his children and build a house although he is faced with a challenge of price fluctuation.He has a dream of having a stable family income.Doviko will use the loan to improve on his gardens by buying fertilizers.

loans.use: to mprove on the garden by buying fertilizers

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 66 years old and married with four children. Ligaya works very hard to provide for them.

Ligaya runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, eggs and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Ligaya has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, eggs and other groceries. 

Ligaya would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, eggs and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a twenty eight year old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is brick making alongside motorcycle ridding for transport business to boost his income. His dream is to build a permanent home and educate his children further despite the hardships of unpredictable weather changes and limited capital. Moses needs a loan to buy fire wood and pay labour.

loans.use: to buy fire wood and pay labour.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is thirty two year old man living in Fort portal, Uganda. For nine year he has been dealing in cloth selling along side farming to boost his income.He faces a challenge of  high transportation cost yet his dream is having a big boutique in town.Ibrahim will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a sixty eight year old man with eight children living in Fort portal, Uganda.He practices agriculture  but also runs a restaurant to boost his income and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay fees for his children and buy more land to increase his farming.Lack of enough capital and un predictable weather are his major challenges yet his dream is to build a permanent house for residence. Charles intends to use the loan to buy more utensils for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more utensils for the hotel.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia works hard to support her family. Virgilia is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Virgilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Virgilia has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana works hard to support her family. Romana is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines.

Romana requested a PHP 12000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Romana has been in this business for 8 years now.

Romana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 69 years old, married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vivencia has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Vivencia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more banana to sell.

Vivencia has been in this business for 9 years. Vivencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more banana to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a bakery business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 60,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients for her bread production business.

Teresita has been in this business for 16 years. Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients for her bread production business

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Adelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, detergent and other groceries.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Adelyn would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Macvil

texts.en:
Ma. Macvil is 45 years old, married with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Macvil has a shells crafting business in the Philippines. Ma. Macvil requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells crafting.

Ma. Macvil has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Macvil would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shells crafting.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish farm in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lilian is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her fish and pigs.

Lilian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her fish and pigs

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 42 years old, married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Geronima has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Geronima requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Geronima has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Geronima would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Florites

texts.en:
Forites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, snack foods and other groceries.

Florites successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

NWTF is re-listing Forites's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a young gentleman aged 24 years old and operates a  motorcycle transport business.He has been in the business for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES. 9,000

He learnt about KADET LTD from other motorcycle riders who are registered with KADET LTD. He has acquired his first loan of KES. 77,000 which will enable him buy his own motorcycle. 


He hopes to use the proceeds to mean his basic needs. His dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a 52 years old a mixed crop farmer and married to Ruth a business lady with whom they are blessed with two children.  He has been practicing mixed crop farming for the past eleven years with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Stanley is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully.  He is glad and appreciates the financial support he has received from KADET and KIVA. His mixed crop farming is doing well. He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizer and seedlings. With the anticipated profits from his farm, he will invest in his children’s education.  

His dreams are to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs i.e fertilizer and seedling

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and married with five children.He has a furniture making business in Makueni town where he make metal doors and window frames for buildings.He also make metal chairs and tables for various schools and hotels in the area.He has been in this business for 10 years now and it has been profitable.

This will be his fourth loan term with KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of materials e.g metal bars for making chairs,doors and window frames.He also plans to buy protective and safety equipments such as gloves and aprons for his workers.

In future,Joseph hopes to expand his business by opening another furniture shop in the area,make more income and be able to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of materials e.g metal bars for making chairs,doors and window frames   and gloves $  aprons

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 44 years old married, and has three children who are in school. 

She is in a transport business in Naivasha which she has been operating for the past four years. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her pay school fees. She paid her previous loan successfully.

She hopes to buy another matatu in the near future.

loans.use: To pay school  fees for her children.

loans.name: Nkosho

texts.en:
Nkosho is 43 years old, married to Naipanoi M., and the father of six children. For the last 13 years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat farming is his specialty and has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

He learned about KADET LTD through advertising posters which had been plastered in his area. This will be his fourth loan of Kes 60,000 which he plans to use to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.
His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is applying for a second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying her first loan successfully. Her retail business is doing extremely well especially after she obtained loan from KADET LTD. She managed to restock her shop thus expanding her customer base. 

She is requesting for a second business loan to purchase more washing detergents, cooking oil, baking powders and sugar. She will use the anticipated profits to support her husband in his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase more washing detergents, cooking oil, baking powders and sugar

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary practices farming in Nakuru and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy seeds and fertilizer. She paid her previous loan successfully. With anticipated profit,she plans to pay school fees for her children.  

In the near future she hopes to increase her farm output.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Miriam Gricelda

texts.es:
La Señora. Miriam forma parte del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha establecido grandes lasos de amistad con todas sus amigas y compañeras del grupo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Miriam tiene 31 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años que están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que viven es de su madre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Miriam trabaja en un taller de tapicería de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, en este trabajo se encuentra desde hace algunos años.

Este crédito es para comprar una máquina de escribir para realizar su trabajo desde su casa. 

Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Miriam has been a member of the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (A Future for Well-Being) communal bank for three years in which time she’s established strong bonds of friendship with all her girlfriends and fellow group members.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that safeguards its history and keeps its colonial architecture intact.  The city’s cuisine is varied and delights the palates of its visitors.  Its people are kind, courteous and keep their culture and traditions alive.

Miriam is 31-years-old and the single mother of two children who are 10 and 8 years of age and attending the little local school in the city.  The house they live in his her mother’s and she shares household expenses with her.

Miriam works in an upholstery shop from Monday to Saturday from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon; she’s had this job for some years.

This loan is to buy a typewriter so she can work from home.  Her goal is to own a car.

loans.use: to buy a typewriter.

loans.name: Gladys Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys esta en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Gladys tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  mayores de edad, dos de ellos están casados pero solo uno vive  independiente, su otro hijo casado  vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su hija soltera también trabaja y ayuda a la economía de la casa. Su esposo labora como instructor de manejo, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Gladys se dedica al comercio de ropa de todo tipo y para todo género, también vende cosméticos de diferentes marcas, su producto lo ofrece desde su casa a sus amigas y conocidas y hay días que también lo vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Su crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de ropa de moda para su clientela.

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Gladys is in the third loan she’s had with the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (A Future for Well-Being) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that safeguards its history and keeps its colonial architecture intact.  The city’s cuisine is varied and delights the palates of its visitors.  Its people are kind, courteous and keep their culture and traditions alive.

Gladys is 55-years-old, married and has had three children who are all adults now.  Two of them are married but only one of them lives independently.  Her other married son lives at home and shares household expenses.  Her single daughter also works and helps out with the home’s economy.  Her husband works as a driving instructor.  She does not own a house; she rents.

Gladys works selling all types of clothes for both genders and also sells cosmetics of various brands.  She sells her goods from home to friends and acquaintances; sometimes there are days when she sells from place to place in the city.
She will use her loan to buy in-style clothes for her clientele.  Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Karina Verónica

texts.es:
La Señora Karina desde hace algún tiempo forma parte del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, de este grupo de amigas le gusta la unión y compañerismo, en cada reunión sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo, se divierte y conversa de varios temas de su interés. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que es conocida por ser la cuna de grandes poetas y escritores, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde Diciembre de 1999.

La Señora. Karina tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa en su tiempo libre ya que también está trabajando como empleada privada, estos dos oficios le dan la oportunidad de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtio en la compra de ropa de la cual obtuvo buenas ganancias, su nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener más variedad para su clientela.
texts.en:
Karina has been a member of the Loma de la Cruz communal bank for some time. She likes the unity and sense of community of this group of friends. In every meeting, she is able to get out of her daily work routine, have fun, and talk about a variety of topics of interest. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known as the birthplace of great poets and writers. It has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999.

Karina, 22, lives with her partner and has a two-year-old son. Her spouse is a merchant. They do not have their own home, so they are renting.

She works as a traveling clothing saleswoman in her free time, since she also works as a private employee. These two jobs give her the opportunity to improve the financial stability of her home and provide for her family.

She invested her previous loan in the purchase of clothing, with which she earned a good income. She will also use this loan to buy clothing so that she can have a greater variety for her clientele.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Dalila Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora Dalia es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz desde hace algunos años, ella es una persona de muy buen humor y muy alegre que contagia a todas sus compañeras del grupo, el banco comunal le gusta por la unión y compañerismo del grupo, también porque los créditos le ayudan a crecer en el negocio.

La Señora Dalila tiene 59 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo es jubilado y ahora labora como comerciante, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Dalia desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de ropa, su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad y tambien viaja a otras ciudades donde tiene clientela que le realizan pedidos. Esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar la economía de su hogar. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa de la cual obtuvo buenas ganancias,  su nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir en ropa para cubrir sus pedidos que tiene que entregar a su clientela.
texts.en:
Dalila has been a member of the Loma de la Cruz community bank for a number of years.  She is a person whose good temper and cheerfulness prove infectious among her fellow group members.  She likes her community bank because of the unity and friendship that exists among its members.  She also likes the loans as they help her to grow her business.

Dalila is 59 years old, married, and has four children: three of her children are married and live independently.  Her son who is still single works and helps out financially.  Her husband is retired and now works as a trader.  She does not own her own home but rents instead.

Dalila has been selling clothing for a number of years.  She sells her merchandise throughout the city and also travels to other cities where she has customers who place orders with her.  This business has allowed her to provide for her children and improve the financial situation of her household.

Dalila invested her previous loan in buying clothing which made her good profits.  She will invest this loan in buying clothing as well so that she can fill some orders that she has to deliver to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Steven is a 29 year old hard working-honest married man with 3 children living in Fort portal –Uganda.He is a very ambitious man who is involved in a number of businesses which include motorcycle transport ,selling bananas and he also does subsistence farming.Price fluctuation and lack of adequate capital affect the business while his dreams are to venture into commercialized agriculture.Steven intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 34 year old hardworking -honest married woman blessed with 3 children living in Fort portal-Uganda.She is a primary teacher by profession and also has a retail shop in order to meet her family daily expenses since her meager salary can hardly meet her needs. She has been in service for twelve years now and she was inspired by her desire to nature young people. Irene intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a forty six year hard working man with five children living in Fort portal, Uganda. He farms on a large scale in order to sustain his family although like any other person in the sector, he faces challenges of un predictable weather changes.Despite the challenges ,he has been able to educate his children and has a dream of educating them all to university level.Moses will use the loan to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en: Paulo used the previous loan to construct cottages, but due to high demand he needs more capital to construct more cottages. In his business, he faces challenges of seasonal weather and price fluctuations. His dream is building a permanent home,constructing shades for his customers and expanding the business into new markets. Paulo intends to use this loan to boost business by constructing grass thatched shades for his customers.

loans.use: to construct grass thatched shades for his customers.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 31 year old hardworking man with 3 children living in Fort Portal,Uganda.His main business is transport along side small scale farming to boost his income.He faces hardships of unpredictable weather changes and poor roads however his desire s to complete building his house and educating his children to higher levels of learning. Christopher is requesting for a loan to buy sand and cement for construction of his residential house.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement for construction of his residential house.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 33 year old married man with 3 children living in Kamwenge,Uganda.He operates a drug shop and he decided to start the business in order to raise income to provide for his family daily needs.High license fees and inadequate capital affect his business while his dream is to own a pharmacy since the demand for drugs is high from his community.Eric intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more feeds for her fish.

Alicia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Alicia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and feeds.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 40 year old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is livestock production, the business he started with a vision of supporting and increasing his income. He also practices farming to boost his income.He has hardships of poor roads which hinder him so much however, he has a vision of buying land to establish a ranch.Justus is requesting for a loan to buy goats and chicken for rearing.

loans.use: to buy chicken and goats for rearing.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 58 years old, married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Felicidad has a general store business in the Philippines. Felicidad requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, diapers, snack foods and other groceries.

Felicidad has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Felicidad would like to build and expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, diapers, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam is a 42 year old hard working single mother living in Fort portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop as well as selling fire wood and charcoal. She began the business 12 years back with the aim of educating the children and supporting her family and has since reaped tangible benefits.Price fluctuation is her major hardship while her dream is to trade in whole sale and construct a good permanent residential house.Zam intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour & general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour & general merchardise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and married with four children. Cheryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Cheryl has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent, diapers and other snack foods. 

Cheryl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 60 years old and married with six children.

Clementina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Clementina has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Clementina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rope making. Editha is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old, married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other sea-foods to sell at her food stall.

Erlinda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other sea-foods to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional trisikad.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional trisikad.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with 5 children.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Josephine successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 52 years old and married with 4 children, one of whom is in school. Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, egg and other seasosings. 

In the future Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rope making business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her rope making.

She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Julita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her rope making.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 36 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Margarita has a shells-crafting business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shells crafting business.

Margarita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shells crafting business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Mary Jane successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Mary Jane's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Naipah

texts.en:
Naipah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dry goods retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of accessories to sell.

Naipah successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Naipah's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of accessories to sell.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Paterna has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Paterna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en: This time, for her 18th cycle loan, Pelagia is borrowing Php 20000 to fund her fish vending business, which was previously funded through Kiva's partner, NWTF.  The business continues to provide Pelagia's family with income that is improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old, married and has 9 children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Virginia has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase computer supplies.

Virginia has been in this business for two years. Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and married with three children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Yolanda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 53 years old and married with three children.

Eva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like saop, can goods, noodles, egg, etc..

Eva has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buy and sell herbal medecine.

Eva aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like saop, can goods, noodles, egg, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a furneture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Jessica is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, etc. for her furniture making business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, etc. for her business

loans.name: Merceditha

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Merceditha works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from faming sugarcane and selling vegetables. Merceditha is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Merceditha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, chips, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Nida is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell can goods, soap, shampoo, spices, etc. for her general store business.

She is successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell can goods, soap, shampoo, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a forty year old married woman with three children living in Kasese,Uganda.For four years she as been an accountant and with the proceeds she has been able to buy land for farming.She was inspired by the conduct of other people in the profession and her vision is to become a certified public accountant.Jessica intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en: Esau is a 31 year old married man with 5 children. He deals in produce where he earns a living from and apart from that he practices farming. He is asking for a loan to buy more produce. He faces a problem of price fluctuations but hopes that one day he will build a permanent house.

loans.use: To buy more produce

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris is a hardworking married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop and he started the business in order to meet his family daily expenses.With the proceeds he has been able to build rentals and pay fees for his children despite challenges of inadequate capital which is a big set back to his business.Chris will use the loan to buy general merchandize such as salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandize such as salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en: Raphael is a forty two year old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.With a dream of constructing rentals and educating his children to higher levels of education,he decided to start a retail shop and he has been in business for three years.Price fluctuation and lack of enough capital are his major challenges .Rapheal is requesting for a loan to add stock like, rice and suger to his business.

loans.use: to add stock like, rice and suger to his business.

loans.name: Mbusa

texts.en: Mbusa is a twenty seven year old married man with two children living in Kasese,Uganda.For ten years he has been operating a bar business and with the proceeds he has been able to educate his children and buy land for farming.Price fluctuation and high cost of rent is his major set back while his dream is to own a depot that supplies the whole western region of the country.Mbusa intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a twenty six year old hardworking man living in Kasese,Uganda.For two years he has been running a retail business and also earns a salary as a civil servant to boost his income.Lack of enough capital is his biggest challenge yet his dream is to expand his business to a whole sale shop.Josephat will use the loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman is a hardworking married man living in Bundibugyo,Uganda.He operates a retail shop along side coffee and cocoa growing to boost his income.A good father that he is,he has been able to educate his children despite challenges of inadequate capital and unpredictable weather changes which affect his out put.His personal desire is to educate his children up to the university while business plan is to trade in wholesale.Sulaiman intends to use the loan to buy general merchandize such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his business

loans.name: Blanca Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca des hace algún tiempo que forma parte del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar y en este grupo ha llegado a establecer buenos lasos de amistad con todas las socias del grupo. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Blanca tiene 47 años, es separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 27, 25 y 19 años de edad, sus tres hijos son casados y viven independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Blanca se dedica a la venta de especierías desde que se caso ya que su suegra le motivo y le enseño este negocio, este negocio le ha permitido mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. 

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de especerías del cual obtuvo buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que necesita comprar clavos de olor, orégano, canela y otras especias para continuar en el negocio. La banca comunal le gusta por los benéficos que recibe y la atención personalizada de su promotor de crédito.
texts.en:
Blanca has been a member of the “Futuro para un Bienestar” (A Future for Well-Being) communal bank for some time now.  She’s established good bonds of friendship with all the group members.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that safeguards its history and keeps its colonial architecture intact.  The city’s cuisine is varied and delights the palates of its visitors.  Its people are kind, courteous and keep their culture and traditions alive.

Blanca’s 47-years-old and separated from her husband but while married had three children who are 27, 25 and 19 years of age.  Her three children are married and live independently. She does not own a house; she rents.

Blanca has worked selling spices since she got married since her mother-in-law encouraged her and taught her the business which has made it possible for her to improve her home’s stability and to move her family forward.

She used the money from her previous loan to buy spices which produced good profits.  She’s repeating the loan because she needs to buy clove, oregano, cinnamon and other spices to stay in business.  She likes the communal bank because of the benefits she gets and the personalized attention she gets from her loan officer.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, star anise, cloves and other spices.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 59 years old and married with two children.

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like bread, cooking oil, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Anecita has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from hog raising.

Anecita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like bread, cooking oil, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 58 years old and married with seven children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods like soap, shampoo, can goods, noodles, etc.

Patricia has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Patricia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: tore-stock her store with food and household goods like soap, shampoo, can goods, noodles, etc

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 48 years old and married with 5 children.

Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Belinda has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Belinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Reginald

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Reginald works hard to support he family.

He has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Reginald is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for he buy and sell charcoal business.
