With this loan, Mrs. Mariam hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 boxes of pasta

loans.name: Elgiz

texts.en:
Elgiz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his father. Elgiz is 22 years old and is a single person.

He started his business 2 years ago repairing water pipes at homes and for organizations. Now Elgiz needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy needed equipment for his business. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his father, who is ill right now. In the future, Elgiz wants to get married and have a big family, because he has a person who he loves. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy equipment

loans.name: Jassem

texts.en:
Jassem is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and has two children. Jassem and one of his children provide the family income, while the other continues his education.

Jassem is a grocer and owns a small grocery store where he sells dairy products, detergents, snacks and soap. He has been in this field since 2010 and has hired an employee already. Thanks to his good customer service, Jassem has gained a good reputation in the surrounding area. 

Jassem is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store and to install an external ceiling. Jassem aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store and to install an external ceiling

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive con su familia. Ella posee una venta de ropa interior para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; ana es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa interior en variedad. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
41-year-old Ana lives with her family.  She has a business selling men's, women's, boys' and girls' underwear.  The clothing that she sells is very good quality and she sells everything at affordable prices.  This has gained her a lot of customers.

Ana is very active and is always working hard to get ahead in life.  For this reason, she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to buy a range of underwear.  This will enable her to satisfy her customers.  Ana hopes that, in this way, she will be able to provide her family with financial security and a full life.

loans.use: to buy a range of underwear

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 39-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard to provide for his family.

Since 2000 her husband has been selling embroidery materials. He purchases a variety of embroidery products and resells at a profitable price.

Shaheen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of embroidery material such as threads, buttons, cloths, etc, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Shaheen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of embroidery products to sell

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 30-year-old housewife with many dreams to fulfil. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder. 

Sumaira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is taking out the loan for her husband, to buy a welding machine and materials like iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods, iron sheets, etc. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She will use the profit for household expenses. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine, etc.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is an Iraqi client, 43 years old, married and a father of four children. Adel is a mechanic and works hard to provide his family income from his garage. He specializes in changing engine oil and fixing tires. He has been practicing this business since 1984 and has very good experience in this field. Since Adel is old in the market, he has gained an excellent reputation.

Adel is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD in order to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work. Adel is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may continue providing for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 53-year-old married woman who is the mother of seven children. She has been working at selling clothes for ten years, but in 2009 she opened the present shop.

Her husband is working abroad in order to provide his family members with a good standard of living. Meanwhile, Salwa works hard here in Lebanon to develop her business and increase her income in order to cover her children's expenses.

Salwa is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection. She hopes to keep on increasing and developing her business in a well managed way so that she can continue to respond to both her customers' and her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his early 20s, is married with a small daughter.  He has been running a Genge Duka (neighborhood shop) selling fruits, vegetables and dry foods like sugar, beans, wheat flour, baking flour, salt, etc., in the same shop for six years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to open the side for dry food.  Previously he used to sell fruits and vegetables and now he has a Genge Duka.  He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more sacks of Irish (white) potatoes.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

Salum will share this loan with his loan group "Uwezesho" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Camilia

texts.en:
Camilia is a 36-year-old Palestinian married woman, mother of four children.

Five months ago, Camilia opened a small convenience store of her own, to help her husband in making their living and covering their expenses.

Camilia showed good work and professionalism in her domain ever since she started. She is working hard to respond quickly to customers' different requests. She is applying for her fifth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with good standing in her paying-back history. Her applied-for loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special summer ice cream and beverages.

She hopes to develop her business and move her shop to a bigger place outside the Palestinian refugee  camp she is living in.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special summer ice cream and beverages

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has three children who are still going to school. She has been running a beauty salon since 2007. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Asha's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a dryer and more salon equipment, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  

She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the salon. Her dream is to one day be able to open a cosmetics shop.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Waefeso," which has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the salon.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 37-year-old woman who trades in soft drinks ((Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, and other sodas). She is a single mother of three children who are in school.

She has been in this business for the past three years and is doing very well. She joined ID Ghana in 2010 through another beneficiary. She is a very dedicated individual and hardworking. 

She is applying for her 7th loan and needs GHS 1,800 to buy more soft drinks to sell to her customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, and other sodas) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.en: Jumakan  is very thankful for all Kiva lenders who supported her first Kiva loan, which was very useful for her big family. She was able to enlarge her herd of cattle and purchase a small tractor for harvest transfer.  Jumakan now is applying for a second Kiva loan, directed for purchasing of a milk cow and potato seeds and crops for planting.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income.

For more than eight years she has been working in her store, where she sells a variety of products including rice, sugar, pulses, flour, etc. Due to the money that she generates, she has managed to provide a better quality of life for her family.

Her greatest wish is to stock her store better, because her customers continuously ask for products which she does not have and that results in a loss of money and customers. 

Therefore, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to invest in the purchase of merchandise which will allow her to elevate her level of income and savings. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Glory Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid-30s, is single and has three children who go to school.  She has been running a business of selling art crafts for 12 years now.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Hadija's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more art crafts and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to repair her house and to pay school fees.  She will use this loan to buy more and better quality art crafts.  Her dream is to one day be able to grow more and sell the art crafts abroad. 

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group "Glory," whose seven members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more and better quality art crafts.

loans.name: Marlin Suyapa

texts.es: Marlín, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en un aladea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.  Marlin siempre le ha gustado el comercio, hace mas de 5 años se ha dedicado a la venta de comidas como baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena con frijoles, queso, crema etc.), encurtidos de vegetales, ticucos (hecho de harina de maíz condimentada relleno de frijoles) y pastelitos rellenos con carne y arroz. Ella vende su producto de manera ambulante a orilla de la carretera hacia el occidente del país donde hay mucha circulación de vehículos. Ha decidido solicitar un quinto ciclo de préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar más insumos para la elaboración de alimentos como es harina de maíz, harina de trigo, manteca, frijoles, arroz, condimentos, vegetales, y otros ingredientes necesarios. Su sueño es seguir creciendo con el negocio y estar siempre con su familia y poder establecer de nuevo una pulpería.
texts.en:
Marlín is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a neighborhood in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.

Marlín has always enjoyed the retail trade. For more than five years, she has been selling foods such as “baleadas” (a flour tortilla filled with beans, cheese, sour cream, and other ingredients), pickled vegetables, “ticucos” (cornmeal combined with beans, similar to tamales), and pastries filled with meat and rice. She sells her products as a street vendor on the edge of a road that leads to the western part of the country. There is a great deal of traffic flow.

Marlín has decided to requested her fifth loan in the amount of 25,000 HNL in order to buy more supplies for making her dishes such as cornmeal, wheat flour, lard, beans, rice, condiments, vegetables, and other necessary ingredients. Her dream is to continue growing in her business and to always be with her family. She would also like to open a new grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal, wheat flour, lard, beans, rice, condiments, vegetables, and other necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Hilda De  La Paz

texts.es: Doña hilda de 41 años de edad, vive con sus padres y su esposo en casa propia es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Doña hilda solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Hilda is 41 years old. She lives with her parents and her husband in a home she owns. She is a responsible and hardworking woman who has gotten her family ahead. She has a small store where she sells bread, beverages, oils, vegetables, fruit, snacks and also basic necessity items such as soap, shampoo and more. Her business is in her house. Hilda is asking for a loan with which she will be able to stock her store even more so she can serve more customers and increase her sales. That is her priority to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 36 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of three daughters. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Since 2000, her husband started selling shawls in the community which is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he is interested to purchase a variety of new shawls to resell at a profitable price. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult.

Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of shawls  so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Samina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shawls to resell at a profitable price.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling embroidery materials, which he has been doing for eight years. He purchases a variety of products and sells them in the market.

Safia is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase embroidery material such as threads, buttons, cloths, etc. so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Safia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery products to sell.

loans.name: Hamidi

texts.en:
Hamidi is a 60-year-old married woman, mother of  three children. She has been working in her own family's bakery for 20 years.

Hamidi is a hard-working woman who puts a lot of effort into developing and improving her family's living. She applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to purchase extra flour at competitive prices.

This is  her fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with good standing in her paying-back history. Hamidi is well-known in her region for the specially baked traditional breakfast bread 'Manakish' and bread with special toppings applied over it.

Hamidi hopes to buy an automatic oven that will increase her production and her income at the same time.

loans.use: To purchase extra flour at competitive prices

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Moría edad de 55 años  vive con su nieta en casa propia, se dedica a la venta de accesorios para uso personal como: lociones, jabones, talcos, etc. También tiene el negocio de una tienda que atiende durante el día donde sus ganancias también son buenas debido a que lleva las dos cosas a la par y por eso las ventas son numerosas tanto como las ganancias, doña Maria solicita financiamiento para la compra de lociones, perfumes, desodorantes, etc.  para poder engrandecer el negocio y lograr tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old and lives with her granddaughter in her own home.  Her business is selling personal care products such as lotions, soap, talc etc.  She also has a store that she serves in all day.  Her sales and profits are high because she carries out both businesses in parallel.  Maria is requesting a loan to buy lotions, perfumes, deodorants, etc. so that she can expand her business and achieve better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, creams, etc.

loans.name: Prode Group

texts.es:
María es integrante de la alcancía “PRODE”, esta alcancía está conformada por 07 amigos, todos trabajadores de la misma zona. María tiene 41 años es separada con 02 hijos jóvenes, ella trabaja vendiendo carne en el mercado de su localidad, también tiene una bodega en su casa donde atiende por las tardes, su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque lo realiza todos los días de la semana y no tiene descanso, gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido brindarle a sus hijos estabilidad económica y estudios, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales. En cuanto a su negocio le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en él, con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar carne al por mayor para poder abastecer su negocio, mas adelante también quiere seguir mejorando la construcción de su casa. 
María quiere decir ¡Muchas gracias a todos por apoyar a nuestro grupo Comunal! En la foto es la señora que viste chompa a rayas (rojo con plomo)
texts.en:
María is a member of the “PRODE” community bank. This group is made up of 7 friends from the same area. María is 41 years old and has 2 children. She works selling meat in her community's market. She also has a store in her house where she works in the afternoon. Her work is very difficult because she does it every day of the week and has no time off. Thanks to her hard work  she has been able to offer her children financial stability and an education. Her biggest dream is for them to have good careers. With her business, she would like to keep investing in it. With the loan she has asked for she will be able to buy meat wholesale to stock her business. In the future she also wants to keep improving the construction on her home. 

María wants to say: "thank you very much for supporting our communal bank!". In the photo, she is the woman in a striped sweater (red and gray).

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 63 años de edad vive con sus tres  hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; marta es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Doña marta  tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Marta de 63 años de edad vive con sus tres  hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; marta es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Doña marta  tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men and children

loans.name: Consuelo Emelinda

texts.es: Doña Consuelo de 72 años de edad vive en cas propia con su esposo, ella tiene una perqueña tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años vende todo tipo de productos, tiene mucha clientela pues los productos los vende a precios accesibles, doña consuelo solicita un credito par poder comprar especias por mayor como: achote, ajonjoli, albahaca, anis, apio, etc. para los diferentes alimentos pues sus clientes buscan ese producto en su tienda y con lo que le queda de ganancia no le alcanza para poder comprarlas y asi poder tener a sus clientes satisfechos cuando lleguen a comprar y ella podra tener mejores ganancias y tendra una mejor estbilidad economica.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 72, lives in her own house with her husband.  She has had a small store in her home for several years.  She sells all types of products.  She has a lot of customers because she sells at affordable prices.

Consuelo's requesting a loan to buy spices wholesale such as achiote, sesame seeds, basil, anise, celery, etc., for different foods.

Her customers look for these products in her store and what's left from her profits isn't enough to buy them.  This way her customers will be satisfied when they arrive to shop.  Also, she'll be able to earn better profits and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy spices

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Luz  es una persona muy  amable, trabajadora, y responsable con las personas que la rodean, actualmente vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus nietos, posee una tienda como negocio fuerte para ella en la cual lleva ya varios años trabajando con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña luz  solicita un crédito para poder comprar huevos, granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, etc. para surtir su negocio debido a que muchas veces se queda sin mercadería y pierde de vender por falta de ello y así podrá establecer en abastecimiento su tienda para no perder clientes por la falta de producto y podrá obtener mejores ingresos y le dará a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luz is a very friendly, hard-working, responsible person who lives in her own home together with her husband and grandchildren.  Her business is a store which is doing well.  She has been running it for a number of years.  She uses the profits that she makes from her sales to cover some of her household expenses.  

Luz is requesting this loan to buy eggs, basic grains, oil, sugar, etc. with which to stock her business as she sometimes finds herself without enough merchandise and therefore loses sales.  She would like to improve her stock levels so that she doesn't lose customers through a lack of goods.  This will make her better income and she will be able to provide her family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy eggs, basic grains, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mercedes, quien con su credikiva logró comprar telas e insumos para fabricar cubrelechos y edredones que vendió rapidamete, aumentando sus ventas y por consiguiente sus utilidades. El número de clientes de su negocio se ha incrmentado y ella está muy satisfecha, por eso pide  a los finaciadores de Kiva que sigan apoyando con recursos a los pequeños empresarios de todo el mundo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikva, con el cual comprará telas e insumos en mayor volumen, para ganara descuentos y fabricar cubrelechos y edredones que incrmentarán su producción y generaran el éxito de su inversión pues tiene asegurado el mercado que los compra.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support Mercedes received with her Kiva loan, she was able to buy fabrics and supplies for making bedspreads and quilts, which sold rapidly. She increased her sales and was able to generate a profit. The number of customers her business serves has increased and she is very satisfied. For this reason, she asks that the Kiva lenders continue their support by providing resources to small entrepreneurs around the world.

Mercedes is currently applying for another Kiva loan in order to buy fabrics and supplies in greater volume. She will be able to obtain discounts and continue to increase her production of bedspreads and quilts. This will generate a successful investment since her products are assured of selling at the market.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies in greater volume.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Doña ana de 34 años de edad  habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ana es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene 10  años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito  para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, etc.  para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados y  así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children.

She works making and selling clothing.  Her business is located in her home.  Ana's an incredible and very exemplary woman because she's very hardworking, responsible, and positive.  In addition, many people recommend her and her work.

She makes a variety of garments at affordable prices.  She also offers quality in her work, which is why many people prefer her.  She has done this work for 10 years, so she has a lot of experience as well as steady customers who prefer her more every day. 

She has decided to request a loan to invest in her small business by buying the supplies she needs to make a variety of garments: fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

She does all this to give her customers better service so they feel motivated to continue requesting her services.  This way her sales and income will increase and her quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabric, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: Doña Maria de 48 años de edad, es una persona amable, responsable,  vive con su esposo y su hija en casa propia, ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta, doña Maria está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Maria is 48 years old. She is a friendly, responsible person. She lives with her husband and daughter in their own house. She has a sewing workshop in her home where she makes different garments. She now has lots of customers because her work is excellent and she sells her garments at very accessible prices. She is very dedicated to her work, responsible and honest. Maria is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase fabric, thread, needles and everything related sewing. These items will allow her to continue satisfying the needs of her customers, so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Irma Yanira

texts.es: Doña Irma de 42 años de edad,  posee un local cerca de su lugar de residencia donde vende chorizos desde hace varios años,  es una persona amable y responsable con las obligaciones que  tiene,  actualmente vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres  hijos con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar,  Doña Irma solicita un crédito para la compra de chorizos por mayor  para engrandecer el inventario de el negocio y que las ventas sean mayores y mas buenas para su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Irma is 42 years old. She has a locale close to her residence where she has sold sausages for several years. She is a kind person and responsible with her duties. Right now, she lives in a home she owns with her husband and three children. With the profits she makes and with her husband's help, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. Irma is asking for a loan to buy chorizos wholesale to increase her business' inventory and to have more and better sales for financial stability.

loans.use: to buy sausage wholesale

loans.name: Taban

texts.en:
Taban is a 39-year-old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married with five children between the ages of 3 and 16. All of them go to school. 

Taban runs a general store and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more juice, soda, Omo (a brand of detergent) and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost.

In five years, Taban would like to expand his business and open a depot.

Taban says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like juice, soda, water, Omo (detergent), etc.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 24 years old and is single. His business is well organized,and he sells various goods such as lotions, soap, juice, Fanta, etc. Theogene has three years of experience in this business, and he works from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day per week, except on Sunday.

Theogene has requested a loan from Kiva lender, Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, juice, Fanta, etc. for resale. With the profit from the loan, Theogene will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, juice, Fanta, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 24 years old and single. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, bananas, Fanta, etc. He has 4 years of experience in this work and operates his business from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day per week except on Sunday. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, to purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, bananas, Fanta, etc. to sell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs, reinvest in his business, and build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotions, soap, bananas, Fanta, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sacarias

texts.es: El señor Sacarias de 40 años de edad,  casado, vive junto a su familia, son de escasos recursos económicos.  Sacarias se dedica exclusivamente a la agricultura y en tiempos libres trabaja como jornalero en diferentes parcelas de su comunidad para así poder mantener a su familia, en la anterior cosecha tuvo problemas climáticos  de sequía, causando una mala producción y  una baja calidad en sus productos e hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos a la familia que se mantienen con la producción agrícola. Cada año producen principalmente cebolla, papa  y frejol.  Este año Sacarias quiere empezar con el pie derecho y  tener una buena producción en sus cultivos es  por eso que está solicitando el crédito para comprar abono orgánico y abono químico, de esta manera mejorar la producción de cebolla y papa. Sacarias trabaja en pequeñas parcelas con su esposa, también tiene la clara idea de que con este crédito mejorará las condiciones de sus cultivos y también mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Sacarias is 40 years old. He is married an lives with his family. They are of low income. Sacarias works exclusively in agriculture and in his free time works as a laborer in different land parcels in his community to support his family. In the last harvest, he had problems with drought, causing poor production and product quality. That made his family income fail, as they support themselves with farm production. Each year they grow mainly onions, potatoes and beans. This year, Sacarias wants to start out on the right foot and have good production with his crops. That is why he is asking for the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizer. This way, he can improve onion and potato production. Sacarias  works on small land parcels with his wife. He also has a clear idea that with this loan, he will improve his crops and also his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 29 years old and single. He has been selling various goods such as bread, juice, water, cakes, toilet paper, etc. for three years. He operates his business every day each week from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., except on Sunday. 

Jean Baptiste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase various goods such as bread, juice, water, cakes, toilet paper, etc. to sell. With his profit, he will save money for his family and re-invest some of it in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as bread, juice, water, cakes, toilet paper, etc. to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old and single. He sells various goods such as cakes, juice, water, tea, etc. He currently employs one person to help him. He has two years of experience in this work and operates his business from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day per week except on Sunday. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase food and drinks like cakes, juice, water, tea, etc. to sell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks like cakes, juice, water, tea, etc. to sell

loans.name: Heylin Julissa

texts.es: La señora Heylin comerciante desde hace cuatro años, junto a su esposa sueña con poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida para darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro, su esposo trabaja para una casa privada y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ella con la ganancia de sus ventas de ropa compra lo que puede de materiales para construir sus casa, a ellos se les dificulta mucho recaudar de una sola vez el dinero por los diferentes gastos que se le presentan, con este credito que se les ha otorgado comprara materiales de construccion como: Bloques, Arena, Cemento, Hierro etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conunto a Fondos Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en: Heylin has been a merchant for four years, along with her husband, so that they can improve their quality of life and give their children a better future.  Her husband works in a private home and helps her with all the household expenses.  With her earnings from her clothing sales, she was able to buy building materials to build her house.  It’s difficult for them to save all the money at once because of the various expenses they have.  This loan will allow them to buy building materials such as cinder blocks, sand, cement, iron bars, etc.  She is grateful to AFODENIC for the Kiva funds they are providing.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Wani

texts.en:
Wani is 49 years old, married, and has five children who attend school.  He lives in Juba. Wani runs a general store, which he has been doing for six years. 

Wani is requesting a loan from Finance Sudan, which he heard about through promotions by the loan officers, for 3,500 SSP, which he will use to purchase more paint, nails, and other items. In five years, Wani would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs.

loans.use: to purchase paint, nails, and other items.

loans.name: Kankelentigui Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Kankelentigui sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de  Kanadjiguila en commune IV du district de Bamako (capitale du Mali). et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles plastiques, de condiments (échalote, ail, jumbo en sachets, huile de palme, pâte d’arachide, moutarde, …) et des petits ruminants. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nina (la 1ère  debout à droite) est une grande vendeuse de petits ruminants de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 moutons à Niono. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et  au marché de Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement d’hommes. Elle espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Kankelentigui group are married and the majority live in polygamous families. They average 38 years of age with five children each. They all live in the Kanadjiguila district of Commune IV of Bamako (the capital of Mali) and know each other through relatives and their income-generating activities in Kanadjiguila market. The members of the group have businesses selling plastic kitchen utensils, condiments (shallots, garlic,
jumbo seasoning, palm oil, groundnut paste, mustard, ..) and small ruminants. With a view to increasing their capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan.

Nina (standing on the far right) is a significant seller of all types of small ruminants. She is planning to use her loan to buy four sheep in Niono. She resells for cash and on credit from home and in Kanadjiguila market to a primarily male customer base. With this loan she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, and, as is the case for all the other women in the group, this will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El Sr. Máximo vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura siembra en terreno de 5 Has herencia de sus padres; produce papa, papaliza y oca, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 3 de engorde y 2 lecheras. El Sr Máximo requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico ya que quiere aprovechar esta época porque los precios son bajos y le entregan en el mismo lugar, por este motivo se apersono a nuestra oficina a solicitar un préstamo, ya que el ahorro que tenia lo invirtió en compra de insumos agrícolas.Por último Máximo se sintió contento al tener la oportunidad de acceder al crédito, además de poder contar con la ayuda de la institución porque con la compra de abono orgánico ya tiene asegurado la siembra de papa y otros productos para la seguridad alimentaria y generar mejores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en: Máximo lives in Colomi. He is 25 years old. He is single and economically independent. He is a farmer and works in five plots inherited from his parents. He grows potatoes, ulluco and oca (root vegetables). He rotates the crops and has experience in the fields. In addition, he has three cows for fattening and two dairy cows. Máximo needs to loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to take advantage of this time because the prices are low and it’s delivered to the same place. For this reason, he came to our office to request a loan. The savings he had were invested in farming supplies. Máximo felt happy about having the opportunity to receive a loan, in addition to having the support from the institution. With the purchase of the organic fertilizer, the planting of potatoes and other products are secured for food security and to generate more income in the future.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 24 years old and single. He owns a business that sells various goods such as clothes, lotions, umbrellas, etc. He has six years of experience in this work. He operates his business every day of the week, except Sunday. 

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as clothes, lotions, and umbrellas for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, lotions, and umbrellas for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 61 años de edad ,es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Rosa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de perfumería y belleza , todos los días sale a visitar a sus diferentes amigos, vecinos y familiares para ofrecerle sus productos esperando poder vender algún perfume, talco o crema corporal, en algunas ocasiones espera que sus clientes acudan a su casa ya que tiene un amplia vitrina en donde exhibe los productos que pone a la venta, lleva realizando 9 años este trabajo y lo hace sola ya que no le gusta trabajar bajo la presión de otra persona. Complementa esta actividad vendiendo eventualmente jugos y empanadas. Durante el tiempo de que lleva trabajando aprendió mucho y reforzó algunas técnicas de venta que antes ya conocía, espera mantener su clientela estable y seguir creciendo hasta establecer una tienda de cosméticos de mayor extensión en donde pueda ofrecer a la venta más productos y tener mejores ingresos económicos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral.Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por productos de perfumería y cosméticos para continuar vendiendo e incrementar su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 61, is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of four children who live with her in her own home. Rosa sells cosmetics, perfumes, and beauty products. Every day she makes her sales by visiting different friends, neighbors, and relatives to offer them her products. She hopes to sell them some perfume, talcum powder, or body crème. On some occasions, she attends to customers who come to her house where she has a large display cabinet that showcases the items she sells. Rosa has been in this line of work for nine years. She manages her business alone and does not like working under the pressure of a boss. Rosa complements her business by selling juices and empanadas on an occasional basis. Throughout the time she has been working, Rosa has learned a great deal and is able to reinforce some of the sales techniques she learned before. She hopes to maintain a stable clientele and continue growing her cosmetics store by adding an extension where she can offer more products to sell, thereby improving her income.

For this opportunity, Rosa is requesting 1,500 PEN. She is very excited to know that there are people who are willing to provide financial support so that she can develop her business. The amount she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise, including perfumes and cosmetics, so that she can continue selling and increasing her clientele.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lorena Angelica

texts.es: lorena habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijo. ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografia. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Lorena lives in a home of her own, along with her husband and three children.  She raises corn and beans and has for several years.  She earns her living and provides the daily bread for her home.  She farms every year and it’s the only way she knows how to earn a living.  She is a very hardworking, honest, and responsible woman and she has decided to request a loan to buy the main farming supplies, fertilizers, insecticides, seeds, etc., as shown in the photo.  She expects to have good results because she doesn’t have another source of income.  She trusts in God that she will be able to obtain an abundant harvest which will allow her to continue providing for her household.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Isaie

texts.en:
Isaie is a 33-year-old married man with one child, who is 4 years old.  He sells cassava and has been in this business for ten years.  His business is open from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. every day except Sunday. 

Isaie has requested a loan, through Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more fertilizer to cultivate cassava.  With the profits he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to cultivate cassava.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Hermelinda en su negocio de venta de comidas, porque su inversión de credikiva pudo obtener mayor volumen de materias primas y aumentar su producción de sancochos, arroz, y hasta incursionó en la venta de mercancías variadas, la que distribuyó entre nuevos clientes, lo cual  le proporciono nuevos ingresos que beneficiaron a su familia.  Su negocio tiene ahora un mayor número de compradores y con sus utilidades continuas ayudando a sus hijos. Ella envía un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por apoyar mi labor, porque este es mi trabajo y mi sustento; gracias por los muchos años en la Fundación“. En la actualidad Hermelinda está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará unas mesas y sillas plásticas y hará adecuaciones a  su vivienda, con su dinamica de trabajo y su disciplana hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support she received for her food business, Hermelinda was able to invest her Kiva loan in a large amount of supplies. She was able to increase her production of stews and rice. Hermelinda was also able to begin selling different types of merchandise and distributing them to her new customers. This resulted in a new source of income that benefited her family. Her business now has a large number of buyers and the profits have enabled her to continue helping her children. She sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Thank you for supporting my work because this is my livelihood and how I support myself. I’m also grateful for the many years that I have been with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.”

Hermelinda is currently applying for a new Kiva loan so that she can buy a few tables and plastic chairs for furnishing her home. As a result of her dynamic work and discipline, her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a few tables and plastic chairs for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seat covers.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.es: La señora Prisca vive en la comunidad de  Entre Ríos, del departamento de Cochabamba con sus tres hijos de los cuales cuida y además sus hijos le colaboran en las actividades que ella realiza. La señora trabaja  vendiendo comida tiene un restaurante que es uno de los lugares más visitados, vende comida desde hace años atrás, es muy dedicada a su actividad, prepara diferentes tipos de platos muy exquisitos y también vende diferentes variedades de refrescos,  por día realiza una venta de 50 a  100 platos en días festivos vende aún más  y refrescos de 40 a 50 unidades. La señora Prisca vive en alquiler en el segundo piso del restaurante, por lo cual con esfuerzo de su trabajo adquirió un terreno urbano donde la señora Prisca va construir su casa propia, para lo cual el capital que tiene no le alcanza para toda la construcción por tal motivo solicita el crédito para llevar a cabo toda su actividad y así vivir en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Prisca lives in the community of Entre Rios, Cochabamba Department, with her 3 children, whom she cares for.  Her children collaborate in her activities.

Prisca sells meals. She has a restaurant and it's one of the most visited local places. She has been selling meals for many years and is very dedicated to her activity. Prisca prepares different types of very rich dishes and she also sells a variety of soft drinks. Each day, she sells from 50 to 100 meals. On festival days, she sells even more, plus from 40 to 50 soft drinks.

Prisca lives in a rental apartment on the 2nd floor above her restaurant.  With great effort in her work, she has acquired an urban lot where she intends to construct her own house. The capital she has at present is insufficient to cover construction costs. That's why Prisca is requesting a loan, to carry out all this activity and, thus, be able to live in her own house.

loans.use: to cover the costs of building her own house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, washing soaps, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new stock of fruits for sale.

loans.name: Los Rincones Group

texts.es: Grupo formado tres socias empresarias una de ellas es Lideth mujer de 35 años de edad, acompañada, hace 7 años que vende queso y cuajadas anteriormente se dedicaba a vender frutas frescas, tiene dos hijos que estudian en sus tiempos libres le ayudan en el negocio, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 13 años, los logros que a adquirido en los préstamos que le han dado es invertir en  la educación de sus hijos, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio. Este producto lo compra al por mayor en el Rama zona atlántica del país y los distribuye a los comerciantes del mercado de Masaya. Considera otro logro es la expansión de su productos a una variedad amplia de clientes  en el mercado sus ingresos aumentan. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra en la compra de queso al por mayor así como las cuajadas. Angela tiene 39 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y Noelia tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pollo.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members. One of them is Lideth, a 35-year-old woman who is in a relationship. She has been selling cheese and curds for seven years. Lideth previously sold fresh fruit. She has two children who are studying, but they help with her business in their spare time. Lideth has been a client of ADIM for 13 years. With the income she generated from her business as a result of acquiring the loans, Lideth has been able to invest in her children’s education. Her products are purchased wholesale in Rama, an area that is on the Atlantic side of the country. She then distributes her goods to the merchants at a market in Masaya. Another achievement to consider is her expansion of products. By widening her variety, she has grown her customer base at the market and her income has increased. Lideth’s loan will be invested in the purchase of cheese in bulk, as well as curds.

Angela is 39 years old and has a grocery business in her home. Noelia is 20 years old and has a business of selling chicken.

loans.use: to buy cheese and curds in bulk.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is happy about being a client of Milango. The transportation business has improved and she was also able to set up a boutique and a food stall. Her challenges now are a small business space and food spoilage. She is therefore applying for a loan of 62,650 KES to purchase a deep freezer for food storage. She looks forward to a more fruitful season ahead.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for food storage.

loans.name: Isunga Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Berna is a 50-year-old widow with 7 children who stay with her.  After the death of her husband, she started a small bar in her village to raise money to look after the family.  She also practices agriculture on a smaller scale to address her family’s needs and to sell the surplus. 

Berna wants a loan of 200,000 to buy organic manure to spread into her banana plantation.  She hopes that with the manure the quality of her plantation will improve as well as her productivity and sales.  This, in turn, will increase her income which will enable her to educate her children and to have a decent living environment for the family.  However, she is challenged by the limited capital as well as the bad weather that always affects agriculture.  

The eleventh person standing in the back of the photo is the Ugafode credit officer

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Vicetnta

texts.en:
Vicetnta is a 29-year-old mother with two children who is married to Joseph, a 37-year-old mason. She has been in the trade of selling slippers, bags and cosmetics for the past three years in the Dansoman community of Ghana. She is doing an excellent job and is hardworking and industrious.

Vicetnta joined ID Ghana in 2012 when a friend introduced it to her. This is her 3rd loan and she needs an amount of 1,000 Ghana cedis (GHS) to buy more slippers, bags and cosmetics to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more slippers, bags and cosmetics to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase much needed stock, including Ethiopian spices and specialty products.

loans.name: Lluvia De La Bendicion 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Minerva is the coordinator of her group 'Lluvia de Bendiciones' (Blessing rain) 1, 2 & 3. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her 8 dependents. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard to provide for her children and family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home with her family, and to attend to the church. 

Minerva is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanding her business. She has had her business for over 5 years, starting with her own saving loan with which she bought a stove and gas tank to fry food. She plans to use this loan to invest in her businesses to increase her inventory by purchasing goods like flour, meat, plantains, potatoes, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her businesses and to provide for her family. She wants to have her family together in a better house.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a shed and a feed store.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav is married and has two children.  He is the manager of a production/training company that teachers high-school students.  He has been working there for 10 years.  Yaroslav also just loves farming.  He is a hardworking, persistent, and responsible person.

Yaroslav is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to repair his bathroom and living room.  The loan will help to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to repair his bathroom and living room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items, such as sugar and flour, to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Dios Verdadero 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Group Dios Verdadero 1, 2 & 3 (True God).  This group is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris.  Juana sells silver and gold jewelry.  This is the 12th loan she has requested from Esperanza, and she is planning to purchase more jewelry and clothes to expand her business inventory. 

She is very excited about these loans.  They made it possible for her to start a business almost six years ago, and she is still running it.  She continues to expand her sales into more products and clients.  Juana tells us that her challenge is to have a sustainable business, to be able to provide for her four children, and to help her long-term partner with extra income.  Her business profits will be used to reinvest in her business.  She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry and accessories.

loans.name: Richmie

texts.en: Richmie is a 28-year-old woman living in Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She has been managing a transportation business for four years. She earns 7,500 PHP a month. In 2008, she became a member of GDMPC Micro-Credit and is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase a transportation vehicle to improve the business. In the future, she dreams to have an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en: Juan Carlos, pictured with his wife, is a farmer from Morelos who cares about the environment. When he decided to open a new slaughterhouse in his municipality, there was significant concern over the waste and odors that would be generated from the blood and manure. Historically, farmers in the region have dumped their waste wherever convenient, polluting watersheds and hurting local biodiversity. Juan Carlos wanted to avoid that and is investing in his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to make sure he doesn't do the same. He will process the waste produced by his slaughterhouse to generate high quality biofertilizer and renewable, methane-rich biogas, reducing his impact on multiple levels: reduced agrochemical fertilizer usage, reduced fossil fuel use, and mitigation of environmental damage caused by properly treating the waste produced on his site. This loan represents 55% of the total price of his system.

loans.use: To purchase a 120-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother with three children.  She lives in her home built with a simple structure, like others in her community.  Sonia lives with her children in the North area from Santo Domingo city, in one of the rural/slum areas around the main city. 

Sonia says her most favorite things to do are to take care of her children and play with them.  Her most important challenge is to continue growing in her life and business.  Since two years ago, Sonia started her clothing sales business with the money she could save from different activities.  Now she is receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional and will invest this capital in her business.  The loan will be used to buy new clothes, cosmetics, shoes and other miscellaneous products.

With her profits, she will reinvest in her business.  She dreams of having a general store in a better location.  Sonia and her group are going to devote themselves to various areas of work such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes, beauty salons, grocery stores, etc.  Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Alexandra María

texts.es: Alexandra de 32 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 16 años de edad, al cual sueña con brindarle la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad y verlo convertido en un gran profesional. Desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, actividad que le genera los recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida, Alexandra se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos, lo que le permitirá garantizar una mejor condición económica y estabilidad a su hogar.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 32, is a single mother of a 16-year-old son; she dreams with providing him with the opportunity of going to university and becoming a great professional.  For some years now she’s been selling fast-food, an activity that generates resources to support her family.

Aiming at increasing sales and improving her quality of life, Alexandra is requesting a loan to buy ingredients which will allow her to guarantee a better economic condition and stability for her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for fast-food.

loans.name: Daisy Alida

texts.es: La Sra. Daisy es comerciante, hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a su actividad, vende todo tipo de material de escritorio, escolar y regalos para acontecimientos importantes, solicita un crédito Kiva para incrementar su capital de operación, es decir quiere comprar más regalos para el día de la madre que ya está cerca por ello se aconseja otorgarle este crédito para que la sra. Daisy pueda seguir trabajando con su actividad y generar mayor ingresos económicos, de estado civil viuda, no tiene hijos vive en su casa sola, inmueble que lo alquila la parte de la primera planta a personas que también se dedican al comercio. Según declaro la sra. Daisy, necesita urgente este dinero para no perder la oportunidad de poder aumentar su mercadería ya que por ahora esta barata y no quiere que se le aumente en el mes que viene por el día de la madre ya que es el mes donde vende más a comparación de los otros meses.
texts.en:
Sra. Daisy is a merchant and has been in business for more than six years. She sells all types of writing materials, school supplies, and gifts for important occasions. Daisy is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can increase her operating capital. She says that she wants to buy more gifts for Mother’s Day since that time is approaching. For this reason, it was recommended that she apply for a loan so that she can continue working in her business and generate more income.

Sra. Daisy is a widow and has no children. She lives alone in her house. Daisy rents out part of the first floor to people who are also merchants. According to her, she is in urgent need of the money because she does not want to lose this opportunity to increase her inventory since prices are low at the moment and will go up in the next month right before Mother’s Day. During that month, she sells more when compared to other months.

loans.use: to buy gifts to sell for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Iris Ivette

texts.es: Doña iris es comerciante, vive con su esposo y sus tres  hijos en casa propia y ella se dedica  ala venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña iris pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar
texts.en:
Iris is a merchant.  She lives with her husband and three children in her own house and she works selling fast-food like fried potatoes, fried manioc, turnovers, tamales, etc. from place to place near her house.  Thanks to her sales, she’s been able to cover her household expenses.  

Iris is asking for financing to buy the ingredients she uses like oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, bananas and everything else she needs to make the fast-food snacks so that she can continue supporting her home and covering expenses that may arise.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Tarcela's Group

texts.en:
Tarcela is 62 years old and married with 5 children.  She lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga.  Tarcela grows assorted crops for a living.  She has been doing this activity for 20 years and earning a monthly income of 4,300.  Tarcela is requesting a new loan to purchase construction materials for house completion.  Tarcela has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 6 years.

Tarcela is the leader of the 2-member group but they have separate responsibilities.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house completion.

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda is 61 years old and married with 6 children.  She lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga.  Lyda has a shop that sells groceries and beverages.  She is able to generate a monthly income of 5,200 from this business.  She has been doing this for almost 20 years. 

Lyda has requested a new loan to purchase 20 boxes of grocery items and beverages as additional stock to sell.  Lyda has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase 20 boxes of grocery items and 20 cases of beverages.

loans.name: Doris Nubia

texts.es:
Doris, de 34 años, es una valiente que con su esfuerzo y dedicación ha alcanzado muchos de sus sueños. Asegura que se ha enfrentado a  grandes pruebas en la vida, pero con el amor por su familia ha superado los obstáculos. En la actualidad tiene una sala de internet y una miscelánea, en donde presta entre otros los servicios de fotocopias. Gracias al desarrollo de su actividad su familia goza de mejores condiciones de vida. 
Con el fin de aumentar su nivel de ventas y ofrecer un mejor servicio, Doris se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía como papelería y artículos para celulares. 
Sueña con expandir su negocio y crecer dentro del mercado local para garantizarle a su familia una condición económica estable.
texts.en:
Doris, 34, is a brave woman who with her effort and dedication has reached many of her dreams.   She insists that she’s faced great trials in life but with love for her family has been able to overcome them.  She currently has an Internet access service and a miscellany store where she provides photocopying services.  Thanks to this activity’s development her family enjoys better living conditions.

Aiming at increasing sales levels and offering better service, Doris is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like stationery supplies and items for mobile phones.  She dreams with expanding the business and growing in the marketplace to guarantee a condition of economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies and mobile phone items.

loans.name: Norey

texts.en:
Norey is married and has two children. She is 26 years old and lives in Nazareth, Pagadian City ZDS. 

Norey sells t-shirts and polo shirts to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. She also has a videoke machine that earns her additional income. Each month she earns about 9,000 PHP. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase new ready-to-wear clothes.

She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future she hopes to have her own stall to display her products.

loans.use: To purchase new ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Emprendedoras En Accion Group

texts.es:
Emprendedoras en Acción es una alcancía formada por 06 amigos. Ana María es la presidenta del grupo, ella tiene 51 años es casada con 02 hijos y 02 nietos, vive en casa de su suegra con toda su familia. Ana María es costurera, fueron sus primas quienes hace 06 años le enseñaron este oficio, ahora confecciona prendas de vestir en su domicilio y está orgullosa de su trabajo porque gracias a eso puede  sostenerse y ayudar a su esposo. Sus clientas son amigas y vecinas de su localidad que siempre solicitan sus servicios. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar materiales para sus confecciones como telas e hilos, está muy entusiasmada por este préstamo y agradecida al saber que personas que no la conocen la ayudaran tanto a ella como a su grupo comunal.
Ana María aparece en la foto con polo amarillo.
texts.en:
“Emprendedoras en Acción” (Entrepreneurs in Action) is a Communal Bank that consists of six friends. Ana María is the group president. She is 51 years old, married, and has two children and two grandchildren. Ana María lives at her mother-in-law’s house with her entire family. She is a seamstress and learned this trade from her cousins six years ago. Now she produces clothing from her home and is proud of her work because she can support herself and help her husband. Her customers are friends and neighbors from her town who are always requesting her services.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics and thread. She is very excited about this loan and is grateful that people who do not know her are willing to help her and the other members of her Communal Bank.

In the photo, Ana María is wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Don José de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, su esposa y sus padres, el se dedica a tomar fotos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia  tiene varios años de trabajar en esa actividad, tiene mucha clientela ya que es una persona amable y realiza un buen trabajo,  don José solicita un crédito para comprar materiales fotográficos como papel, rollos y otros instrumentos para su trabajo y así seguir  dándole lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Don José is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his three children, his wife, and his parents. He is in the business of taking photographs. His business is located in his home and he has been in this line of work for several years. José has many clients since he is a friendly person who does good work.

Don José is requesting a loan so that he can buy photography supplies such as paper, rolls of film, and other instruments for his work. As a result, he can continue providing for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy paper, rolls of film, and other supplies.

loans.name: Oshita's Group

texts.en: Oshita is 56 years old, single and has no children. She lives in Del Pilar, Baliangao, where she earns a living by selling beauty soap and other products. She has been in this business for a year and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional supplies to sell. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for nine years and leads a two-person loan group.

loans.use: to buy beauty soaps and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Amigas Unidas” esta conformada por 05  mujeres carismáticas, que el transcurso del tiempo han ido mejorando sus negocios con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Ydelvina de 33 años es separada y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad (3-5). Ydelvina comenzó trabajando en una peluquería con los conocimientos que adquirió y los deseos de superación toma la decisión de emprender su propio negocio donde actualmente cuenta con un salón de belleza la cual brinda servicio de cortes de cabello, manicure, pintados entre otros. Su mayor anhelo es tener su casa propia. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de tintes, tijeras y una mesa donde pueda atender. El grupo “Amigas Unidas” agradecen el crédito brindado. Ydelvina es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color rosado y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
The “Amigas Unidas” (United Girlfriends) communal bank is composed of five, charismatic women who as time has passed have been improving their businesses aiming at improving the quality of life of their families.  Ydelvina, 33, is separated and has two minor children (3 and 5).  Ydelvina started working in a barber shop and with the skills she learned and the drive to improve she decided to open her own business.  She currently owns a beauty salon where she provides haircuts, manicure and hair styling, among other services.  Her greatest wish is to own a house.

She will use the requested loan to buy hair color, scissors and a table to tend from.  Ydelvina is third from the left wearing a pink shirt and blue pants.

The “Amigas Unidas” group is grateful for the granted loan.

loans.use: to buy hair color, scissors and a table.

loans.name: Micaela Bastida Ii Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 8 mujeres  emprendedoras    y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “MICAELA BASTIDA II”.La Sra. Toribia  de 39 años de edad casada  y madre de  4 hijos, ella se dedica hace 3 años  al reciclaje de papel  La Sra. Toribia nos cuenta que con mucho empeño y trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo ah ido generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un pequeño almacén  propio donde poder almacenar  sus papeles y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en ampliar su local de reciclaje de papel y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Toribia  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Toribia  se encuentra parada en el medio se distingue  con un polo manga larga de color marrón, se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The community group “Micaela Bastida II” is made up of eight women entrepreneurs with a lot of creativity for business. Toribia is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She has worked for three years recycling paper. Toribia tells us that with a lot of hard work and the help of her husband, she has been earning income to cover household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own small storage space where she could store her papers and therefore improve her income.

Toribia is requesting this loan to increase the size of the location she uses for her paper recycling business, which she says will help her get ahead. Toribia and all of the members of the group say they are very grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence that has been placed in them. Toribia can be seen in the middle of the photograph in the brown long-sleeved polo shirt. She would like to close this message by giving her promise that she will comply with all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to increase the size of the location she uses for her paper recycling business.

loans.name: Rubio

texts.en:
Rubio is 23 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a poultry business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 1,500 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase feed for the chicken. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the chicken.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an electronic shop business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy supplies for her electronic repairs.

Flora successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her electronic repair shop business.

NWTF is re-listing Flora's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her electronic repair shop

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is 36 years and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. 

Silvina feels better now that she has applied for her first loan of $ 600.00 She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as gasoline (petrol). She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy petrol

loans.name: María Yeni

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de fritos en su barrio cerca al colegio, lugar estratégico para la venta de sus productos. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano e inicia su faena hasta horas de la tarde. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una nevera con el fin de adquirir productos perecederos al por mayor y almacenarlos con el fin de evitar su descomposición. 
Asegura que con dicha inversión mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y podrá ofrecerle a su hijo de 14 años una mejor educación.
Sueña con poder establecer su negocio en un local para evitar las pérdidas que le genera el mal clima.
texts.en:
María, 39, makes a living selling fried snacks in her neighborhood near the school, a strategic location to sell her products.  She gets up very early every day to start her job and works until the afternoon.

Currently she's requesting a loan to invest in buying a refrigerator to acquire perishable products wholesale and store them so they won't go bad.

She's certain that with this investment she'll improve her family's quality of life and be able to give her 14-year-old son a better education.

She dreams of being able to set up her business in a place where she can avoid the losses she suffers from bad weather.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator
